Title: Client Service Intern (EMEA)
Description:
Location: Morocco
About Us
TGM Research is one of the fastest growing and most innovative market research companies, offering valuable insights to businesses across various industries. We are committed to delivering high-quality market research solutions to our clients by connecting them with the right participants through our online panels.
Job Description
As a
Client Service Intern
at TGM Research, you will play a crucial role in building and maintaining strong relationships with our clients. You will be supporting in managing and growing key client accounts, ensuring client satisfaction, and maximizing their utilization of our online panels.
Along with promoting and selling our research/panel services, you will be helping contacting our clients and directly supervising the project execution with the support of a fieldwork team.
We offer a 6-month internship contract.
Responsibilities
Support lead generation and sales efforts.
Assist senior team members with inbound requests.
Provide updates, address inquiries, and ensure client satisfaction.
Anticipate client needs and maintain proactive communication.
Update CRM and track key metrics.
Coordinate research projects for on-time, high-quality delivery.
Spot and resolve project challenges.
Suggest process improvements and participate in internal training.
Stay informed on industry trends and share ideas.
Qualification
Recent graduates eager to develop in sales and client management.
Degree in Marketing, Business, Economics, Sociology, or related fields.
Interested in developing sales skills and building client relationships.
Strong communication and people skills.
Fluent English and additional language, preferably Arabic, French, Spanish or Polish, another language will be an advantage
Creative problem-solver with a growth mindset.
Independent and team-oriented.
Proficient in Microsoft Office.
Experience in research or data analysis is a plus.
Benefits
Fully remote position
Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses
Professional development opportunities
International Team setup
Flexible Working Policy
A collaborative and innovative work environment
Working with newest technologies and using modern tools
Reporting line:
you will be reporting to Research Director.
If you are a fast-learner, proactive, curious, team player and would like to learn more about market research and online panels, we invite you to join our team and help our clients succeed in their research endeavours.

Title: Execution & Enablement Manager - MENAT
Description:
Why should you join dLocal?
dLocal enables the biggest companies in the world to collect payments in 40 countries in emerging markets. Global brands rely on us to increase conversion rates and simplify payment expansion effortlessly. As both a payments processor and a merchant of record where we operate, we make it possible for our merchants to make inroads into the worldâ€™s fastest-growing, emerging markets.
By joining us you will be a part of an amazing global team that makes it all happen, in a flexible, remote-first dynamic culture with travel, health and learning benefits, among others. Being a part of dLocal means working with 1000+ teammates from 30+ different nationalities and developing an international career that impacts millions of peopleâ€™s daily lives. We are builders, we never run from a challenge, we are customer-centric, and if this sounds like you, we know you will thrive in our team.
Whatâ€™s the opportunity?
Lead operational excellence across dLocalâ€™s Payins network by building and managing long-term, value-driven relationships with processors, acquirers, APM providers, card schemes, and issuers.
Be the primary operational partner manager for key partners, owning partner health, performance improvements, and commercial outcomes.
Work cross-functionally (Customer Success, Commercial AMs, Product, Compliance, Global Payins) to reduce costs, increase approvals and reliability, and deliver best-in-class merchant go-lives.
Drive measurable impact: improve approval rates, reduce latency and costs, lower incident escalation, and accelerate merchant time-to-revenue.
Lead the end-to-end process of identifying, evaluating, negotiating, and implementing new payment methods, as well as optimizing existing solutions, to ensure continuous operational excellence and seamless integration across the business.
What will I be doing?
Partner & processor management
Own day-to-day operational relationship for assigned partners: onboarding, credential/contract changes, operational migrations, and go-live readiness.
Coordinate root-cause investigations and remediation with partners and internal teams to resolve business and technical blockers
Coordinate with Business Assurance and relay processor feedback; support market-specific needs and practices to improve continuity
Enablement & commercial responsibilities
Negotiate pricing, SLAs and special commercial terms; enable partner features and new payment flows.
Manage the fines process: track, upload evidence, and ensure card-scheme mandates are implemented
Merchant-facing operational support
Provide hands-on enablement and hypercare for merchant integrations and go-lives; act as the escalation contact for CS and AM teams during critical incidents
Performance optimization & market intelligence
Analyze rejection reasons, partner performance, and routing to implement initiatives that increase approvals and reduce costs.
Identify and help integrate new operational capabilities (new tenders, features) and benchmark partner performance against market standards
Governance, reporting & continuous improvement
Maintain and drive the Partners Health Matrix; run health reviews and deliver action plans.
Report progress, risks and outcomes to stakeholders; own core KPIs and continuous improvement initiatives
What skills do I need?
4â€“6+ years in payments/fintech operations, partner/processor or issuing and acquiring management (experience with card schemes and APMs strongly preferred)
Proven ability to negotiate pricing, SLAs and commercial agreements with partners
Strong understanding of payment flows and operations (APIs, webhooks, credentials, routing, settlement, reconciliation); comfortable working with Product and Engineering
Data-driven mindset with strong root-cause analysis skills
Proficient with Excel/Sheets; SQL or BI tools a plus
Working knowledge of scheme mandates, fines processes, and operational compliance (AML/KYC considerations)
Excellent communication and ability to influence across functions and with external partners
Experience leading cross-functional programs, merchant go-lives, and driving actions under tight timelines
Bias for action, ownership, strong organisation, and ability to operate across time zones and manage multiple initiatives
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or related field; fluency in English (additional languages a plus)
What do we offer?
Besides the tailored benefits we have for each country, dLocal will help you thrive and go that extra mile by offering you:
Remote work: work from anywhere or one of our offices around the globe!*
Flexibility: we have flexible schedules and we are driven by performance
Fintech industry: work in a dynamic and ever-evolving environment, with plenty to build and boost your creativity
Referral bonus program: our internal talents are the best recruiters - refer someone ideal for a role and get rewarded
Learning & development: get access to a Premium Coursera subscription
Language classes: we provide free English, Spanish, or Portuguese classes
Social budget: you'll get a monthly budget to chill out with your team (in person or remotely) and deepen your connections!
dLocal Houses: want to rent a house to spend one week anywhere in the world coworking with your team? Weâ€™ve got your back!
For people based in Montevideo (Uruguay) applying to non-IT roles, 55% monthly attendance to the office is required
What happens after you apply?
Our Talent Acquisition team is invested in creating the best candidate experience possible, so donâ€™t worry, you will definitely hear from us. We will review your CV and keep you posted by email at every step of the process!
Also, you can check out our webpage, Linkedin, Instagram, and Youtube for more about dLocal!
We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

Title: Marketing Communicator
Description:
En ABB, ayudamos a las industrias a ser mÃ¡s eficientes y limpias. AquÃ­, el progreso es una expectativa - para usted, su equipo y el mundo. Como lÃ­der del mercado mundial, le daremos lo que necesita para lograrlo. No siempre serÃ¡ fÃ¡cil, crecer requiere agallas. Pero en ABB, nunca correrÃ¡s solo. Run what runs the world.
Este Puesto Reporta a
Business Communications Manager
Your Role And Responsibilities
The Marketing Communicator is responsible for developing and executing comprehensive communication strategies that support product launches, solution campaigns, and organizational initiatives relevant to Sustainable Energy Agile Unit across global markets. This role ensures consistent, impactful messaging through digital channels, events, and customer engagement, translating strategic objectives into clear narratives that drive brand awareness, adoption, and stakeholder alignment. The MarCom expert will be hosted in the Sustainable Energy Create Awareness team and reporting to the Marketing Communications Smart Power Chapter
The work model for the role is:
hybrid.
This role is contributing to the
Electrification Smart Power globally.
You Will Be Mainly Accountable For
Developing and implementing integrated communication strategies for Agile Units, ensuring alignment with divisional goals, consistent messaging across all channels, and continuous optimization through performance tracking.
Designing and executing marketing communication plans for product, application, and tool launches by creating tailored value propositions, managing promotional and digital initiatives, and partnering with cross-functional teams to drive successful outcomes.
Leading campaigns for products, tools, and solutions through compelling storytelling, building narratives that emphasize customer success, producing diverse content across multiple platforms, and positioning offerings as innovative answers to client needs.
Managing communications with customers and Local Sales Organizations by delivering timely product updates, providing enablement resources and toolkits, and fostering trust through transparent, customer-focused messaging.
Planning and delivering trade shows and customer events that reinforce strategic objectives, designing impactful experiences, overseeing logistics and promotional activities, and leveraging events to generate leads, collect insights, and strengthen long-term relationships.
Qualifications For The Role
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Communications/Journalism/Public Relations or a related area desirable. At least 7 years of experience in a global multination organization or big PR/media and events agency in a communications, events lead or related role.
Proven track record of content management, digital channels management and leading multi-format events from digital to physical and hybrid) with measurable impact. (5+ experience).
Business driven personality with strong business acumen, resilience, and proactive drive to deliver results.
Creative problem-solver with a track record of developing innovative communication strategies and campaigns, skilled at translating strategic vision into actionable communication initiatives that drive measurable business impact.
Excellent storytelling, editing, and presentation skills, with the ability to adapt tone for diverse audiences.
Possess an enhanced ability to collaborate effectively across diverse cultures, geographies, and time zones, fostering inclusion and alignment, comfortably using collaboration tools and digital marketing practices.
Strong project management skills, operating as part of a team organizing, planning, and executing large-scale projects from vision to implementation ensuring strategic alignment and execution excellence with measurable outcomes.
Whatâ€™s in it for you?
We empower you to take the lead, share bold ideas, and shape real outcomes. Youâ€™ll grow through hands-on experience, mentorship, and learning that fits your goals. Here, your work doesnâ€™t just matter, it moves things forward
More About Us
ABB Smart Power provides energy distribution solutions for data centers, industrial and manufacturing plants, critical infrastructure and commercial buildings. The Divisionâ€™s technical teams work closely with industry partners, delivering advanced solutions that support rapid growth, energy transition, and sustainability objectives. The Divisionâ€™s portfolio includes industrial circuit breakers, low-voltage systems, motor starting applications, and safety devices like switches and relays. Its Power Protection unit supports the worldâ€™s largest data center companies with advanced energy-efficient UPS solutions. Title: Senior Security Supervisor
Description:
Additional Information
Job Number
25141516
Job Category
Loss Prevention & Security
Location
The St. Regis La Bahia Blanca Resort Tamuda Bay, 267 Route Fnideq, Fnideq, Morocco, Morocco, 93200VIEW ON MAP
Schedule
Full Time
Located Remotely?
N
Position Type
Non-Management
Position Summary
Due to the local law regulations, we are looking for a local candidate fluent in Arabic, French and English.
Patrol all areas of the property; secure rooms; assist guests with room access. Conduct emergency response drills, daily physical hazard/safety inspections, investigations, interviews, and key control audit. Monitor Closed Circuit Televisions and alarm systems. Authorize, monitor, and document access to secured areas. Assist guests/employees during emergency situations. Respond to accidents, contact EMS or administer first aid/CPR as required. Gather information and complete reports. Maintain confidentiality of reports/documents, release information to authorized individuals. Defuse disturbances in accordance with company policies and procedures. Resolve safety hazard situations. Handle all interruptions and complaints. Escort unwelcome persons from the property. Ensure compliance with alcoholic beverage control laws. Call for assistance using proper code responses. Provide proper paperwork to employees.
Assist management in training, motivating and coaching employees; serve as a role model and first point of contact of the Guarantee of Fair Treatment/Open Door Policy process. Follow all company policies and procedures; report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager; complete safety training and certifications; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards; anticipate and address guestsâ€™ service needs; thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak with others using clear and professional language; prepare and review written documents accurately and completely; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals; listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees. Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards. In addition, some states may have additional licensing/registration requirements to be considered for this position. Read and visually verify information in a variety of formats (e.g., small print). Visually inspect tools, equipment, or machines (e.g., to identify defects). Enter and locate work-related information using computers and/or point of sale systems. Move at a speed required to respond to work situations (e.g., run, walk, jog). Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time or for an entire work shift. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 pounds without assistance and objects weighing in excess of 75 pounds with assistance. Grasp, turn, and manipulate objects of varying size and weight, requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination. Move through narrow, confined, or elevated spaces. Move over sloping, uneven, or slippery surfaces as well as up and down stairs and/or service ramps. Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.
Preferred Qualifications
Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.
Related Work Experience: At least 2 years of related work experience.
Supervisory Experience: At least 1 year of supervisory experience.
License or Certification: None
At Marriott International, we are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer, welcoming all and providing access to opportunity. We actively foster an environment where the unique backgrounds of our associates are valued and celebrated.â€¯Our greatest strength lies in the rich blend of culture, talent, and experiences of our associates. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, including disability, veteran status, or other basis protected by applicable law.
Combining timeless glamour with a vanguard spirit, St. Regis Hotels & Resorts is committed to delivering exquisite experiences at more than 50 luxury hotels and resorts in the best addresses around the world. Beginning with the debut of The St. Regis hotel in New York by John Jacob Astor IV at the dawn of the twentieth century, the brand has remained committed to an uncompromising level of bespoke and anticipatory service for all of its guests, delivered flawlessly by a team of gracious hosts that combine classic sophistication and modern sensibility, as well as our signature Butler Service. We invite you to explore careers at St. Regis. In joining St. Regis, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International.
Be
where you can do your best work,
begin
your purpose,
belong
to an amazing global team, and
become
the best version of you.

Description:

Then, this is the adventure youâ€™ve been waiting for!

You'll work closely with our founding team to define our technical vision.
This is a full-time position, carried out from our beautiful offices in Dubai, Lisbon or full-remote from anywhere in the world.
French And English Fluency Is Required.
YOUR MISSION ğŸš€
ğŸ¯ Your main goal
will be to take Paradoxâ€™s online learning experience to the next level by building the new Paradox App, a state-of-the-art application that integrates AI, delivers an unparalleled user experience. You will be THE key player in creating an online learning management system that can handle several cohorts of hundreds of students at the same time and scales effortlessly to support thousands of students.
Our sources of inspiration are Apple, Nike, Spotify, Disney for their obsession of excelling, having a worldwide impact and not just selling products but
crafting experiences.
You will be playing a pivotal role in making Paradox play at that level and becoming an iconic brand.
To do so, here are your 5 responsibilities :
1 | BUILD & INNOVATE
Develop new features that enhance the Paradox App and redefine how users learn online.
Implement AI-driven functionalities that personalize the learning experience.
Continuously test, iterate, and push boundaries to improve performance and usability.

2 | SCALABILITY & PERFORMANCE
Ensure the application can handle large volumes of concurrent users while maintaining speed and reliability.

3 | USER CENTERED DESIGN

4 | PROBLEM SOLVING & TROUBLESHOOTING
Investigate and resolve technical challenges to ensure a seamless user journey.
Analyze recurring issues and proactively implement solutions to prevent future problems.
Work across teams to ensure a stable and efficient system.
5 | COLLABORATION & COMMUNICATION
Actively participate in tech architecture discussions and planning sessions.
Provide and seek constructive feedback to continually improve the development process.
Work within Agile frameworks to ensure timely and high-quality delivery.
DO YOU RECOGNIZE YOURSELF? ğŸ˜
Must Have
3-6 years of experience in Full Stack Development, or as CTO of a startup.
Deep expertise in TypeScript & React.js (minimum 3 years experience).
Proficient in Tailwind CSS for sleek and responsive designs.
Strong AI mindset â€“ you actively integrate AI into your workflow.
Passion for writing clean, maintainable, and scalable code.
Personality
Youâ€™re a problem-solver who thrives on tackling challenges.
Detail-oriented: Clean code is your signature.
Autonomous and proactive: You donâ€™t just execute; you bring ideas to the table.
You love learning, iterating, and improving
You continuously learn and experiment with new technologies
Youâ€™re organized, rigorous, and adaptable
Nice to Have:
Experience with Nest.js.
Experience with LMS applications and mobile development.
IT MIGHT NOT BE FOR YOU ğŸ™…â€â™€ï¸
Letâ€™s be clear, we are looking for someone who is not just Great, and for whom Paradox ambition isnâ€™t just another cool project; but a true mission.
So if those
personal interests :
personal development / coaching / professional growth / education / edtech / teaching / edutainment
are not things you REALLY love, and want to solve for other, letâ€™s forget it
Letâ€™s forget about it also if,
You donâ€™t like to be challenged and grow in your job
You don't like receiving or giving tough feedbacks
You donâ€™t question the status quo: the process are there for a reason, we have always done it this way
You like to have very specific & fixed tasks assigned to you. Be told what to do and how to do it.
Your only driver is joining a full-remote company: yes, our company culture is cool, but we want people to care about our mission, products, and their job!

HIRING PROCESS ğŸ“ƒ

Welcome aboard!
About Our Hiring Process
Our recruitment process is tailored to do our best to avoid that you or us realize that weâ€™re not a perfect fit. Every step serves a purpose and will allow us to get to know you better as much as itâ€™ll help you understand more where youâ€™ll be stepping in.
We also want you to have time to ask all of your questions regarding the mission, the long-term vision of your team and the company, our values, with the relevant interlocutor in front of you.
But maybe YOU WONDER WHATâ€™S OUR STORY ? ğŸ˜‰
At Paradox, we are convinced that people do not want â€œjust a jobâ€ anymore.
We are all craving to have an impact through our professional journey. Some want to start their own venture, some want to become an intrapreneur in their current organization, some others just want their day-to-day tasks to have more meaning.
ğŸ¯ PARADOX HAS ONE GOAL: TO EMPOWER PEOPLE AND ORGANIZATIONS TO LIVE THEIR TRUE AMBITIONS.

It needs to change, and weâ€™re here to make it happen!
â­ï¸ OUR AMBITION IS TO MAKE SUCCESS THE ONLY POSSIBLE OUTCOME FOR OUR CLIENTS (WHATEVER SUCCESS MEANS FOR THEM), BY CRAFTING INNOVATIVE & CAPTIVATING BREAKTHROUGH EXPERIENCES.
In other words, we want to make personal growth
as entertaining as watching Netflix.
How, you might be wondering?
We travel the world and surround ourselves with top entrepreneurs (Richard Branson - Founder of Virgin, Marc Simoncini - Founder of Meeting, Fred Mazzella - Founder of BlablaCar), world athletes (Tony Parker - Hall of fame NBA Player, Frederick Bousquet - World record in 50m free swimming, Frank Leboeuf - WorldCup Footballer), and artists (Gad Elmaleh - Comedian, Franck Dubosc, Barry Osborne - Producer of Lord of the Rings and Matrix) âœŠ;
We reverse engineer their strategies for achieving success and fulfillment and lean on the latest researches about neurosciences âš™ï¸;
We deliver trainings & educational contents around Power Skills (critical thinking, productivity, leadership, public speaking, coaching, stress management, etc.), self-growth and performance, through a balanced set of e-learning programs, events and edutainment videos ğŸ’¡.
From one well-known Founder to a team of +45 people today (and counting!), this approach has paid off and enabled us to exceed 2 million followers on social networks, and to have thousands of people attending our online events and training courses.
ğŸ”¥ TOGETHER, WE ARE DRIVEN BY ONE DREAM:
Helping 100 000 people achieve their dream and display their pictures on what we call the â€œ100 000 dreams wallâ€ ;
Giving our clients access to constant personal growth by reinventing their learning experience ;
Leverage AI and other technology to provide an outstanding customized experience to millions of people for them to transform their lives.
And thatâ€™s where you come in. Join the Paradox Revolution !

Title: Civil work engineer

Studies & Preparation
Perform civil engineering layout studies for technical buildings, foundations, chambers and junction boxes.
Define and optimize routes for trenches and cable ducts / PEHD and associated civil works.

Works Supervision & Coordination

Ensure that all quality records, ITPs, WMS and civil documentation are properly maintained.
Technical Interface

Coordinate with track, catenary and power supply teams to avoid conflicts and reworks.
Escalate and help resolve technical blocking points between GC and other disciplines.
Provide technical support and clarifications to site installation teams.
Documentation & Reporting

Provide inspection reports, concrete test reports and GC acceptance reports.
Maintain and update GC As-Built drawings and documentation.
Contribute to handover documentation towards Installation and T&C teams.

â–ª OTD (On Time Delivery) for site activities
â–ª Quality, EHS, RSA (Railway Safety Agencies): monitoring, anticipation and reporting on progress and issues
Educational Requirements
Mandatory: â–ª Engineering degree in Civil Engineering or equivalent.
Experience
Mandatory: â–ª Proven experience in civil works for railway or major infrastructure projects. â–ª Experience in excavation, trenching, concrete foundations and buildings. â–ª Experience in planning and monitoring civil works on site.
Competencies & Skills
â–ª Quality and EHS-focused, rigorous, team-player
â–ª Decision-making and problem-solving ability
â–ª Resilience, with an analytic way of thinking in order to solve Field complex deviations and issues
â–ª Strong leadership skills to manage multiple workers and suppliers
â–ª Good communication with internal and external stakeholders (PM, client, AMO, subcontractors).
â–ª Proficiency in AutoCAD, civil tools (e.g. Covadis), and standard office tools (Excel, MS Project).

Title: Manufacturing & Process Development Engineer
Description:
At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world.
Why You Should Join
The Manufacturing & Process Development Engineer Performs technical tasks including research, development and the improvement of manufacturing processes to maximize efficiency, ensure safety and minimize the excessive use of resources.
Your Main Tasks
Support Product Engineering to optimize Design for manufacturing (DFM) & Design for Assembly (DFA)
Configuration of the best possible equipment, tool and/or processes with cost calculation to support managerial decision
Lead the PFMEA for process under development
Master problem resolving methods with analytical mindset
Support introduction of new product (documents, change management and production release)
Follow up of cost, timing and quality in NPI or strategic projects
Control of progress steps during tool / equipment build phase (global supply base)
Provide samples and measurement report to PE for evaluation, perform capability studies (Cp, Cpk, SPC, â€¦.)
Check of tool / equipment for release acc. Specification
Run Acceptance test (at supplier / plant) of the equipment for release acc
#jobsEMEAAB
Your Ideal Background
Hold an engineering degree ( Bac+5) with a specialization in Automation, Industrial, or mechanical Engineering
Experience and knowledge in the field of assembly technology (Mechanical Design / Automation / PLC programming / Test programming)
Experience in manufacturing filed, 2-4 years
Knowledge of molding or stamping is a plus
Extensive understanding of LEAN manufacturing processes
Experience in project management is a plus
Customer orientation and high level of commitment
Willingness to drive continuous improvements
Very good oral and written communication skills in English
Ability to work in a matrix environment with a multicultural team
Strategic thinking-Presentation skills
Competencies
About Te Connectivity
TE Connectivity plc (NYSE: TEL) is a global industrial technology leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive, and connected future. As a trusted innovation partner, our broad range of connectivity and sensor solutions enable the distribution of power, signal and data to advance next-generation transportation, energy networks, automated factories, data centers enabling artificial intelligence, and more.
Our more than 90,000 employees, including 10,000 engineers, work alongside customers in approximately 130 countries. In a world that is racing ahead, TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS. Learn more at www.te.com and on LinkedIn, Facebook, WeChat, Instagram and X (formerly Twitter).
What Te Connectivity Offers
We are pleased to offer you an exciting total package that can also be flexibly adapted to changing life situations - the well-being of our employees is our top priority!
Competitive Salary Package
Performance-Based Bonus Plans
Health and Wellness Incentives
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Community Outreach Programs / Charity Events
Employee Resource Group
IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING RECRUITMENT FRAUD
TE Connectivity has become aware of fraudulent recruitment activities being conducted by individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent TE Connectivity. Please be advised that TE Connectivity
never requests payment or fees
from job applicants at any stage of the recruitment process. All legitimate job openings are posted exclusively on our official careers website at te.com/careers, and all email communications from our recruitment team will come
only from actual email addresses ending in @te.com
. If you receive any suspicious communications, we strongly advise you not to engage or provide any personal information, and to report the incident to your local authorities.
Across our global sites and business units, we put together packages of benefits that are either supported by TE itself or provided by external service providers. In principle, the benefits offered can vary from site to site.

Title: Sales Manager
Description:
We are looking for a proactive, result-driven, focused, ambitious and experienced Sales Manager.
This person is responsible for supporting the Director of Sales and his Team in consolidating the Hotel within specific markets and market segments, securing business and forging long-lasting relationships with key advisors and end-clients.
Main Duties And Responsibilities
Drives and manages accounts production by excellent account management
Maintains strong relationships with the existing client base and improve loyalty
Proactively prospects new business and brings it to a close generating new revenue streams for the property, and meeting property sales strategy
Proactively follows up on quotations and actively engages with clients to maximize conversion of business
Autonomously arranges external sales appointments / sales trips, site inspections and fam trips when appropriate and relevant for every segment
Inputs activity on the Hotelâ€™s database, ensuring time efficiency and data accuracy
Determines the accounts' needs, Hotel's objectives, and marketing activities of each assigned market/account
Continuously communicates the benefits of the Hotel to clients and showcase our Resort
Meets the objectives as set forth by the Director of Sales & the Director of Marketing & Commerce
Be accountable for all targets and goals set for area of responsibilities
Attends departmental and hotels meetings when requested by the DOS
Develops marketing intelligence, new products ideas, competition activities, new customer trends and performance
Supports the companyâ€™s philosophy and culture by upholding our Values and the â€œLegendary Quality Experiencesâ€ standards, ensuring Guest satisfaction and contributing to the achievement of our Vision and Mission.
Specific Requirements
Bachelorâ€™s degree preferred or equivalent work experience
At least 2-3 years of experience as leader in sales â€“ Previous Five Star/Luxury Hotel Sales Experience is essential
Must have an established network of connections
Strategic Account Management on assigned markets
Strong presentation and interpersonal skills
Excellent business negotiation and customer relationship management skills
Available to travel abroad
Fluent in English and French, a third language would be an advantage
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Has a proactive mindset & Good problem-solving skills
Team-player
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications and HMS, Delphi
Must work well in stressful high-pressure situations; maintain composure and objectivity under pressure
Excellent organizational skills and ability to work in dynamic and fast-changing environment
Proven negotiation skills required; must be able to persuade and influence key decision makers in the marketplace
Understands the importance of closing the business
Must be able to work a flexible schedule that will accommodate the achievement of all business goals and directives

Title: SUPPLY CHAIN SUPPORT V
Description:
At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world.
Job Overview
TE Connectivity's Supply Chain Managers are responsible for the timely, cost-effective procurement, inventory control, planning and quality control of production materials. They ensure the availability of materials in the supply chain, as scheduled, and the maintenance of inventory at the established levels. They coordinate and integrate the flow of materials and information among suppliers, manufacturers, distributors and customers, identifying opportunities for improving efficiency, effectiveness and capabilities of the supply chain. Resources are focused on continuous improvement of the movement of materials through production processes, and the establishment of key performance metrics and benchmarks to monitor actual performance against goals.
What Your Background Should Look Like
Educational Degree: BAC+5
Professional Experience (years In What Processes And Function)
+2Years in SC planning in industrial sector.
Special Qualifications, Knowledge & Skills
Engineering or master degree in industrial Eng/supply chain.
Good communication skills in English.
Excellent ERP & Process Knowledge.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Minimum 2 years prior working experience in industrial environment
Competencies
Values: Integrity, Accountability, Inclusion, Innovation, Teamwork

Title: Technical Engineer leader Door trims
Description:
Company Description
Join the world of the future in a fast growing international company!
At SEGULA Technologies you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects and help shaping the future within an engineering company which is at the heart of innovation. From 3D printing, augmented reality, connected vehicle to the factory of the future â€“ new technologies are part of our 13,000 ingenious collaboratorsâ€™ day-to-day life. Would you like to join in?
Whether you are a student, young graduate, engineer or experienced project manager, at SEGULA Technologies you will find the opportunity to give a new meaning to your career. Skills development is a big part of SEGULA Technologiesâ€™ DNA, the company offers the possibility to move between sectors and positions, as well as attractive geographic mobility opportunities.
SEGULA Technologies is always looking for new, ingenious, and daring talents worldwide to support all the major industrial actors within the automotive, aeronautics, energy, railway, naval, oil & gas and pharmaceutical sectors.
Do you have a touch of genius? Take a new challenge and join us!
For more information: https://www.segulatechnologies.com
Job Description
you will be in charge of :
Steering of material and part management for the project
Planning, follow up and tracking of all development and validation activities
Investigation of part failures
Validation of part changes according functional and durability requirements.
Management of manufacturing assembly try outs and trial runs on changed parts.
Design release on parts changed or modified for higher quality, based on legal and O/V requirements.
PIV Plan update, execution & control for all quality driven changes according
Supporting the Engineering Leaders (PE) with any change of the BOM through BOM commission.
Support and enables to meet the defined diversity targets.
Support to validate the quality targets (IQx).

Leading the design phase. Establishing weekly meetings with with the supplier.
Responsible for the change request
Manage product evolution with ME and / or the supplier. Participating in the monthly meetings lead by purchasing.
Responsible for release process
Manage release in time with help / escalation to CP.
Provide technical kick-offs of responsible parts according to the schedule after purchasing confirmed in the TKO-meeting the readiness and provided the purchase orders.
Qualifications
A successfully completed degree in the field of automotive engineering, mechanical engineering
Experience in the area of Plastic interior and exterior trims
Strong knowledge of the dashboard and console scope
Knowledge of PLM software is a plus
Experience in project work and in dealing with OEM's
Fluent knowledge of English & French
Team-oriented, independent and self-reliant way of working

Title: Fractional CTO / Technical Partner (Health Infrastructure)
Description:
We are building AtlasCare, a health transaction protocol focused on e-prescription and traceability of clinical acts in regulated environments.
The system is already live as a working prototype, with ongoing discussions around pilot deployments in Morocco. We are now looking for a fractional CTO / senior technical partner to help harden the system and prepare it for real-world pilot deployment.
This is not a greenfield role and not a typical startup CTO position. The focus is on architecture, robustness, security, and scalability, in a context where reliability and regulatory constraints matter more than speed.
What youâ€™ll do:
â€¢	Review and strengthen the existing architecture and technical choices
â€¢	Define the roadmap from prototype to pilot and early production
â€¢	Set security, reliability, and compliance standards appropriate for healthcare
â€¢	Act as a technical counterpart in discussions with partners and institutions
â€¢	Provide senior guidance on engineering decisions (hands-on coding optional)
What weâ€™re looking for:
â€¢	Senior engineering or CTO experience (10+ years preferred)
â€¢	Experience with complex, transactional, or regulated systems (health, fintech, govtech, infra)
â€¢	Strong systems thinking and pragmatic decision-making
â€¢	Comfortable operating in early-stage, low-resource environments
â€¢	Ability to engage at both technical and strategic levels
Engagement & compensation
â€¢	Fractional involvement (1â€“2 days per week)
â€¢	Equity-based compensation at this stage (with vesting and cliff)
â€¢	Opportunity to evolve into a longer-term leadership role as the project scales
If youâ€™re interested in helping build foundational health infrastructure, feel free to reach out.

Title: Cloud Program Analyst
Description:
Position
Cloud Program Analyst
Job Description
Arrow Enterprise Computing Solutions
(ECS), a part of Arrow Electronics, brings innovative IT solutions to market to solve complex business challenges. We deliver value-added distribution, business consulting and channel enablement services to leading technology manufacturers and their channel partners. We help businesses grow faster, operate efficiently, and transform in a dynamic market. We are looking for Business Development Manager to join our dynamic sales team in Arrow ECS (https://www.arrow.com/globalecs/).
About Us
Arrow Enterprise Computing Solutions (ECS), part of Arrow Electronics, is a leading global provider of IT solutions that help businesses grow faster, operate efficiently, and transform in todayâ€™s dynamic market. We partner with industry leaders like Microsoft and AWS to deliver innovative cloud solutions, supporting customers across EMEA and North America. Our mission is to empower organizations with the tools, programs, and expertise they need to succeed in the cloud-first world.
What Youâ€™ll Be Doing
As a
Cloud Program Analyst,
you will play a key role in driving and managing cloud programs across multiple regions. Youâ€™ll report directly to the Global Lead for Microsoft Azure and work closely with suppliers (Microsoft, AWS) and internal stakeholders to ensure seamless program execution. Your responsibilities will include:
Managing global programs such as Azure migrations, AWS Well-Architected Framework adoption, and funding program execution.
Acting as the primary point of contact between suppliers, internal teams, and stakeholders.
Leading multi-country program execution, ensuring alignment with business objectives, budgets, and timelines.
Educating and supporting stakeholders on cloud program capabilities and partnership opportunities.
Monitoring, analyzing, and reporting on program performance to identify areas for improvement.
Supporting governance processes and ensuring compliance with internal and supplier standards.
Driving operational excellence by optimizing processes and managing multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Who Weâ€™re Looking For
We are seeking a
junior to mid-senior professional
with strong project management and stakeholder engagement skills. The ideal candidate will have:
Project management experience in a global, multi-country environment.
Familiarity with Cloud / Microsoft products and services (Azure, AWS) â€“ highly preferred.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and influence decisions.
Excellent communication skills (fluent in English, written and verbal).
Ability to educate, influence, and build trust with stakeholders at all levels.
Experience in process optimization, documentation management, and program governance.
A proactive, results-oriented mindset, comfortable in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Whatâ€™s In It For You
A full-time permanent role within a globally recognized IT leader.
The chance to work on strategic, high-impact programs with Microsoft and AWS.
A dynamic international environment, collaborating with teams across EMEA and North America.
Opportunities for career growth and professional development in cloud and project management.
A culture that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
Full Permanent contract,
Social advantages: CNSS, CIMR, Health insurance.
Location:
MA-Casablanca, Morocco (Boulevard Al Quods)
Time Type
Full time
Job Category
Business Support
