We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBMâ„¢. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBMâ„¢ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.

, designed as a foundational intelligence layer for systems that must evolve in complex, changing environments. It supports a shift from reactive processes to continuously learning, adaptive supply networks.
ğŸ§  What you will work on
1) Multi-tier value-chain modelling
Model real industries as graphs of suppliers, factories, parts, flows and dependencies.
2) GNN-driven simulation
Use Graph Neural Networks to simulate how shocks move through the network, running large numbers of what-if scenarios (factory shutdowns, logistics failures, geopolitical events) to see how nodes, volumes and lead-times are affected.
3) AI agent behaviour under stress
For every simulation, run the AI mitigation agent and observe how it reacts â€” what actions it proposes, which trade-offs it makes.
4) Iterative reinforcement loop
Use those outcomes to iteratively reinforce and refine the agentâ€™s reasoning and decision logic, so it becomes better at handling future disruptions over time.
ğŸ›  Who should apply
Students interested in: Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering, Operations research, AI, Graph Neural Networks, Reinforcement Learning, complex systems.
No coding is required. The work is done by running, testing, evaluating and refining models in VistaDeep Platform.
ğŸ“ Ideal academic profiles
This role is a strong fit for candidates studying or graduating in:
Industrial Engineering
Supply Chain Engineering
Operations Research
Systems Engineering
Complex Systems or Decision Science
ğŸŒ Why VistaDeep
Youâ€™ll be helping build autonomous, learning systems that run the worldâ€™s supply chains.
If you want to work on AI that reasons, simulates, decides and adapts, this is it.
#AI #GraphNeuralNetworks #ReinforcementLearning #AutonomousSystems #SupplyChain #VistaDeep

Title: Internship Full-Stack Developer â€“ Backend-Oriented
Description:
Company: AutoApp Solutions
Location: Sfax, Tunisia (Hybrid â€“ primarily remote)
Job Type: Internship (Paid)
Duration: 5â€“6 months
Role Summary
AutoApp Solutions is offering a backend software engineering internship for a final-year student to support the development of a web-based software application. The intern will contribute to backend components under technical supervision and collaborate with other members of the development team.
Success in this role is demonstrated by completing assigned backend tasks, implementing required features according to specifications, and ensuring proper integration with other application components.
This role is part of the backend development team and interacts with frontend and CI/CD contributors as required for system integration.
Responsibilities
Assist in backend development using Java and Spring Boot
Implement and test RESTful APIs
Support integration of backend components within the application
Participate in debugging, testing, and basic documentation tasks
Collaborate with team members using version control tool
Qualifications
Final-year student in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
Basic knowledge of Java
Familiarity with Spring Boot through academic or personal projects
Understanding of REST APIs and backend application concepts
Ability to work collaboratively within a software development team
Work Location
Remote work is the primary mode
On-site presence in Sfax may be required occasionally, depending on project needs
Internship Structure
Initial onboarding and training focused on tools, workflows, and project understanding
Development phase involving contribution to backend application components under supervision

Title: Food and Beverage Manager
Description:
We are looking for an F&B Manager with immediate start for a resort in Northern Tunisia belonging to a prestigious multinational hotel group:
We are looking for a talented and dynamic F&B Manager with experience in 4/5 star Resorts of repute, ideally with international brands.
The ideal candidate should:
- Has worked at least 2 years' of relevant experience in the same role in resorts of the same level.
- Has worked in setting up and running big multidimensional operations.
- Handle multiple Food & Beverage outlets: Self-service buffet, a la carte and theme restaurants, bars and banqueting.
- Handle team of 70+.
- Has an extremely sound knowledge in all the functional areas of Food & Beverage operations, particularly menus development, sales and costing management, staff training, quality control, implementing hygiene standards of the highest level, etc.
- Be a task master with strong leadership qualities.
The successful candidate can expect:
- An attractive salary package.
- Corporate training.
- A unique professional experience in a multinational context.
*This job offer is intended to refer to both sexes.
*All CVs must be sent including authorisation to process personal data.
Industries: Hospitality and Food and Beverage Services

Title: Goldstar - Product Data Assistant - German Speaker
Description:
Job Description
Job Title
: Product Data Assistant - German Speaker
Location
: Tunis, Tunisia
Reporting to:
Global Product Data Lead - Enterprise Data
Overview of Role:
The role of the Product Data Assistant will be to organise, maintain, and publish Goldstar product information and content using software including PIM, Oracle, Repoman, ATP, MCP, Goldstar Website Admin, and multiple Sourcing Platforms specific to the promotional products industry. You will work with a variety of web-based programs to manage product data, pricing, images, and documents, in support of Goldstarâ€™s product merchandising needs, supporting both existing and new products, while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail. Additionally, there will be projects to support GS customer data needs with data gathering, spreadsheets, presentations, etc. Responsibilities include management of product data files, language translations, and day-to-day support for Goldstar team needs.
Performing the role in line with the Goldstar Values:
Family - Treating our customers and our Goldstar team members like family
Simplicity - Ensuring all of our solutions we supply for our customers are easy with no hassle
Delighting our customers â€“ We make sure every customer enjoys working with us by exceeding their expectations and providing the highest level of customer service and a quality product
Work hard, play hard - Work hard and give our all and at the same time love and enjoy what we do
Primary Duties & Responsibilities
Work on German language needs for data and merchandising
Work with team to assemble detailed product data and process improvements for merchandising & products.
Direct editing of new GS website platform & Sourcing Platforms with new/phaseout SKUs, process changes to keep information up to date.
Manage Product Databases, Industry Platform data files and customer product databases â€“ provide hands-on management of both customer & sourcing platform data files, ensuring they are up-to-date and uploaded to relevant websites and industry platforms.
Sourcing platform optimisation â€“ Undertake research to ensure Goldstar products are optimised on industry sourcing / search platforms
Language translations â€“ employ meticulous attention-to-detail in translating marketing materials from English into other languages, then proof reading and sign-off for printing
Maintain Product Image & Template library, working with NPI & GS graphic artists as needed
Maintain Goldstar channel data and images in PIM.
Work with Samples Dept., Quality Control and Production teams as needed
Help maintain a library of GS Compliance documentation
Assure items are activated for GS in Oracle and work with NPI team for any corrections
Track inventories of active SKUs and communicate stock status issues
Other duties and projects as required including but not limited to samples service support, Industry Market research, and other support tasks
Requirements & Qualifications
A bachelorâ€™s degree is an advantage
2+ years in a previous product, administrative, marketing or online/data management
Languages â€“ Written and oral fluency in English and German languages required, in addition, French is a plus
Meticulous attention to detail is one of the most important skills for this role â€“ you will be able to demonstrate how you let nothing slip through the cracks
Knowledge of Cimpress MCP, PIM, and similar systems, is a big advantage
Computer literacy and proficiency in standard Microsoft Office applications and Excel in particular, database experience is a plus
Strong administrative abilities - excellent organisation and time management skills and a capacity to manage multiple projects
Problem solving skills - The ability to think on your feet, the ability to work hard under pressure, and great problem-solving skills are three essential attributes for this role
A sense of urgency and the ability to work in a fast-paced and challenging work environment
Our values
At National Pen, we are guided by a set of core values that define our culture and approach to hiring:
Customers-First:
We are committed to delivering exceptional customer experiences, both internally and externally. By understanding and fulfilling customer needs, we create impactful solutions that leave a lasting impression.
Continuous Improvement:
We believe in the power of growth and evolution. Through open communication and a culture of innovation, we continuously strive to enhance our business and adapt to changing landscapes.
Goal-Oriented:
We set clear objectives, remain disciplined in execution, and hold ourselves accountable for achieving measurable goals. Our focus is on driving results and making meaningful progress.
Integrity:
We prioritize ethics in everything we do, ensuring that our actions are grounded in integrity and responsibility towards our planet, products, and people.
People-Centric:
We value and respect every member of our team, fostering an environment where diversity is celebrated, contributions are recognized, and growth is encouraged.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation - no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.
Goldstar :
Goldstar, part of the global National Pen Group, is one of the industryâ€™s fastest growing Trade Suppliers. With a strong presence in both Europe and North America, Goldstar is becoming famous for offering a strong range of writing instruments, bags, and drinkware, combined with headache-free, all-inclusive pricing and a passionate team who will do whatever it takes to delight their customers. Goldstarâ€™s mission is to become the best supplier in the industry, providing our distributors with amazing products and unparalleled service.

Job Description
Project Title
Design and Development of the ISO 14001 & ISO 45001 Documentation System Integrated into the Existing IMS
Mission Summary
This project focuses on creating the complete documentation architecture required for ISO 14001 and ISO 45001, aligned with the existing IMS (ISO 9001 + ISO 27001) based on Annex SL.

Define documentation structure
Create environmental and OH&S policies
Write mandatory procedures
Develop operational controls & emergency procedures
Create templates, forms, and registers
Integrate documents into the IMS structure

Environmental & OH&S policies
Mandatory procedures
Operational controls
Updated IMS documentation tree
Templates & forms
Digital document management proposal

Creates the documentation backbone and ensures coherence between all standards.

Engineering
student
or
Masterâ€™s degree student
in:
Environmental Engineering
Industrial Engineering
Health & Safety Engineering
Quality Management
Environmental Management
Or any related field
Knowledge of ISO management systems (ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001, ISO 27001) is a strong asset.

All your information will be treated confidentially, in accordance with the Equal Opportunities Directive (EEO).

Title: Finance Accountant
Description:
The Financial Accountant is responsible for managing financial transactions, preparing financial reports, and ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations. The incumbent will maintaining accurate financial records and providing insights to support strategic decision-making within the organization.
Key Responsibilities
Prepare and maintain financial records, reports, and general ledger accounts in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).
Reconcile bank statements and ensure proper documentation and approvals.
Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
Analyse financial information to identify trends, variances, and areas for improvement.
Manage accounts payable and receivable functions.
Ensure compliance with company policies and relevant accounting standards (e.g., IFRS, GAAP).
Support audits by providing necessary documentation and explanations.
Prepare and file tax returns, including income tax, VAT, and other relevant taxes, ensuring compliance with local regulations
Assist in budgeting and forecasting activities.
Maintain fixed asset register and perform periodic asset verifications.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams on financial initiatives and process improvements.
Experience, Skills And Competencies
Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or a related field. Inter CA qualification is a must
4-6 years experience as an accountant or in a similar role.
Solid understanding of accounting principles and financial reporting.

Title: Customer Sales & Service Agent - Cote d'ivoire

To provide the highest level of service in order to sell Emirates airline tickets and services and to assist customers with managing their travel plans. Work as part of a team to achieve individual, station and network Commercial objectives

Title: Key Account Lead
Description:
Our mission
We're making Africa the first cashless continent.
In 2017, over half the population in Sub-Saharan Africa had no bank account. That's for good reasonâ€”the fees are too high, the closest branch can be miles away, and nobody takes cards. Without access to financial institutions, people are forced to keep their savings under the mattress. Small business owners rely on lenders who charge extortionate rates. Parents spend hours waiting in line to pay school fees in cash.
We're solving this by building financial services that just work: no account fees, instantly available, and accepted everywhere. In places where electricity, water and roads don't always work, you can still send money with Wave. In 2017, we launched a mobile app in Senegal for cash deposit, withdrawal, and peer-to-peer and business payments. Now, we have millions of users across 9 countries and are growing fast.
Our goal is to make Africa the first cashless continent and that's where you come in...
How you'll help us achieve it
Wave is now the largest financial institution in Senegal, with over 7 million users. And weâ€™re still in the early days of our product roadmap and potential impact on peopleâ€™s everyday lives.
We are seeking a highly experienced salesperson who is excited by a challenge and passionate about Wave's mission; a dynamic, out-of-the-box thinker willing to do whatever it takes to achieve our mission of making CÃ´te dâ€™Ivoire cashless! You will be responsible for selling Wave's payment and business products to key corporate clients as we rapidly expand our business in CÃ´te dâ€™Ivoire.
As a Key Account Lead, you will be part of the sales team responsible for prospecting and acquiring new high-revenue business customers.
In this role, youâ€™ll;
Business Development (Prospecting):
Actively identify and target high-potential companies and organizations (large corporations, structured SMEs, NGOs, government institutions) that can use Wave Business services.
Build and maintain a robust sales pipeline.
Sales Cycle Management:
Conduct sales presentations and product demonstrations for decision-makers (CFOs, CEOs, HR Directors).
Understand client needs in-depth to propose customized solutions (e.g., salary payments, supplier payment collection, invoice collection).
Negotiate contract terms and ensure closing.
Strategy and Reporting:
Track and report on key sales performance indicators (KPIs) using our CRM tool.
Provide structured field feedback to the Product and Marketing teams to improve our Business offerings.
Conduct competitive intelligence on the Business offerings of other players (banks, telcos).
Key details
Location: You'll work from our office in Abidjan and may travel to upcountry locations.
Work authorization in CÃ´te d'Ivoire is required.
This is a permanent position.
Our salaries are competitive and calculated using a transparent formula.
We offer generous health insurance for yourself and your dependents.
We support working parents by offering 26 weeks of parental leave for mothers and 4 weeks for fathers, in addition to subsidized childcare when they return to work.
Airtime reimbursement.
Free food and a beautiful office space.
Requirements
At least 5 years of experience in a similar position (ideally in an international company, a bank, a mobile money company, or similar)
A degree in sales, project management, finance, international relations, business management, or a comparable field.
Good command of:
French: Fluent (spoken and written) - Primary working language.
English: Professional proficiency required to communicate with regional teams and management.
You might be a good fit if you
Have complete mastery of the B2B sales cycle, from prospecting to negotiating complex contracts.
You have an existing and relevant professional network in Abidjan (particularly with CFOs, HR Directors, and CEOs of large companies).
Have excellent communication, active listening skills, and persuasive ability. You know how to adapt your discourse for high-level stakeholders.
You are "mission-driven," have an appetite for challenge, and a demonstrated culture of performance (a track record of exceeding targets).
Have the ability to work proactively and organized in a very dynamic and fast-paced start-up environment.
Our team
We have a rapidly growing in-country team in Senegal, CÃ´te d'Ivoire, Mali, Burkina Faso, The Gambia, Uganda, Niger, Sierra Leone, and Cameroon plus remote team members spread across the world.
We're deeply passionate about our mission of bringing radically affordable financial services to the people who need them most.
We foster autonomy for our employees. You'll own your projects at every stage, from understanding the problem to monitoring your solution in production.
We raised the largest Series A in Africa in 2021. Our world-class investors, include Founders Fund, Sequoia Heritage, Stripe, Ribbit Capital, Y Combinator, and Partech Africa.
We are onÂ Y Combinator's top companies by revenue.
How to apply
Fill out the form below, and upload a resume in English and aÂ cover letter describing your interest in Wave and the role.
We review applications frequently and recommend that you apply to the role that most closely aligns with your skills, experience and career goals.
Wave is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Act an an Emirates ambassador within in the assigned sales territory and represent Emirates during functions

Competitive salary

Title: Senior Metallugist
Location: Dabakala, VallÃ©e du Bandama, CÃ´te d'Ivoire
Description:
PURPOSE & OBJECTIVE
Reporting to the Metallurgical Superintendent the primary role of Senior Plant Metallurgist is to support the Metallurgical Superintendent and is accountable for the effective and efficient operation of the Metallurgy function (strategy and execution) to deliver to maximized production and minimized costs while ensuring operational sustainability.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Health, Safety and Environment (10%)
â€¢ 0 LTIâ€™s.
â€¢ 0 Fatalities.
â€¢ Minimum of 4 hazard reports per month.
â€¢ Minimum of 1 Planned task observation per month.
â€¢ Minimum of 1 Safe act observation per month.
â€¢ Minimum of 1 Workplace Inspection per month.
â€¢ Maintain HSE standards and ensure strict compliance within Metallurgical team.
Metallurgical performance of the Process Plant (35%)
â€¢ Manage the implementation of the metallurgical accounting system to enable ongoing reliable reporting on the performance of the Process plant
â€¢ Ensure metallurgical data is accurate and updated in a timely manner
â€¢ Ensure daily survey of the process done accurately and continue to investigate opportunities for improvement
â€¢ Ensure recording of data and collection of samples done accurately
â€¢ Monitor and account reagent/consumables usage for the process plant
â€¢ Ensure the collection and recording of data from instrumentation done on a regular basis.
â€¢ Initiate and Implement cost reduction program.
Support to Operations (15%)
â€¢ Provide assistance in the operation of the process where required
â€¢ Ensures the process operates at a high level of technical performance
â€¢ Ensure process control loops are optimized
â€¢ Report laboratory data to Operations staff in a timely manner
â€¢ Assist in Operator Training as required
Optimization of the Process Plant Performance (15%)
â€¢ Continue to investigate opportunities for process improvement. Conduct monitoring, sampling, testwork and process auditing programs. Report findings in an accurate and timely manner.
â€¢ Investigates and implements opportunities to increase competitive advantages and align them with the organizationâ€™s overall strategy.
Metallurgical Test Work (10%)
â€¢ Manage ongoing metallurgical test work programs for Ity CIL project. Test work completed accurately on schedule.
â€¢ Set up and make schedule for daily and project test work.
â€¢ Input into the annual budget production plans and ongoing quarterly forecasts, including reagent/consumable usage rates, production and recoveries data (5%)
â€¢ Provide support to Metallurgy Superintendent to concise plans for achieving the gold production as required.
â€¢ Production of the annual production schedules in the template for inclusion into the operations budget model for review by the management group.
Assay Laboratory Support (5%)
â€¢ Ensure Process and Metallurgy samples are delivered in a timely manner and non-routine samples are submitted according to correct procedure.
â€¢ Review assay results and check for accuracy, report any variations immediately.
â€¢ Liaise with assay laboratory and ensure all procedures are adhered to.
â€¢ Recruitment, training and management of the Metallurgy Department (5%)
â€¢ Set up the training program of the metallurgical department employees.
â€¢ Participate in recruitment process to ensure department is sufficiently staffed by qualified personnel.
â€¢ Manage the development and writing of procedures for the metallurgical activities and test work
Safety Management:
â€¢ Demonstrate personal commitment about safety and environmental and Social Responsibility practices.
â€¢ Ensure every person within the team is fit for work.
â€¢ Ensure that agreed procedures, safeguards and controls are applied and used
â€¢ Ensure all activities are conducted safely and in accordance with Company standards and procedures
â€¢ Ensure hazard management plans are observed.
â€¢ Keep statutory and internal reporting as required.
SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE
Education:
â€¢ Bachelorâ€™s or masterâ€™s degree in chemical Mineral Processing or Metallurgical Engineering or BSc Metallurgy
Relevant Experience
â€¢ Minimum 8 Yearsâ€™ Experience in Mineral Processing production with significant exposure to gold operations and management experience
â€¢ Previous experience in complex gold plant operations including those with high values of copper, silver in feed and associated detoxification circuit concerns
â€¢ Knowledge of metallurgical accounting practices and procedures
â€¢ Previous experience within a gold processing laboratory
â€¢ Previous experience at senior supervisory level
â€¢ Ability to interpret metallurgical results
â€¢ Able to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization and build effective relationships and networks
â€¢ Possess strong training and mentoring skills
â€¢ Demonstrate strong conceptual skills, and be capable of developing lateral and practical solutions
â€¢ Ability to respond to a changing work environment
â€¢ Ability to manage multiple projects and tasks at the same time
â€¢ Reputation for integrity and ethic

Title: IT Operations Associate
Description:
Our mission
We're making Africa the first cashless continent.
In 2017, over half the population in Sub-Saharan Africa had no bank account. That's for good reasonâ€”the fees are too high, the closest branch can be miles away, and nobody takes cards. Without access to financial institutions, people are forced to keep their savings under the mattress. Small business owners rely on lenders who charge extortionate rates. Parents spend hours waiting in line to pay school fees in cash.
We're solving this by building financial services that just work: no account fees, instantly available, and accepted everywhere. In places where electricity, water and roads don't always work, you can still send money with Wave. In 2017, we launched a mobile app in Senegal for cash deposit, withdrawal, and peer-to-peer and business payments. Now, we have millions of users across 9 countries and are growing fast.
Our goal is to make Africa the first cashless continent and that's where you come in...
How you'll help us achieve it
Our IT Operations team manages our IT infrastructure across all countries with Wave operations. This team ensures that employees have the necessary hardware, software, and internet access to perform their roles efficiently. In addition, the IT Operations team manages various components of the IT infrastructure, including telephony operations, networks and internet, servers, and data centers, across multiple processes such as onboarding, offboarding, employee training, compliance, information security operations, and ticket management.
As an IT Operations Associate, youâ€™ll ensure that our principal and support offices have reliable and robust internet connections and support employees, teams, and internal partners with initial troubleshooting resources.
You will be expected to ensure the reliability of our SMPP connections, which enable customers to receive SMS notifications on time, as well as SIP connections. You may be responsible for managing this office location or team and collaborating closely with other IT and telephony team members in Africa, as well as your manager, as we rapidly scale our business. This will help us maintain desirable visibility and agent activation rates.
In this role, you'll;
Be part of the team that manages internet access at office locations with 99.9% uptime, including liaising with external suppliers.
Assist in the development or setup of new systems and networks.
Participate in an on-call rotation of ticket management and troubleshooting in support of employees, Product & Engineering teams, and external partners.
Troubleshoot, analyze, debug, and interpret network connection issues and error logs from our ISP and SMS & SIP telephony platforms.
Support onboarding new employees with software, hardware, and IT best practices.
Support in permission and hardware management for employees.
Assists users by answering questions regarding computer software or hardware operation and providing support to resolve problems promptly.
Provide quality IT support and service by interacting positively with our staff, answering inquiries, and effectively handling complaints.
Support with system integration tasks between our product teams and external partners.
Read and write basic SQL queries to pull reports and troubleshoot issues.
Please liaise with our Telco partners to process monthly billing invoices and manage the SIM fleet.
Provide a daily report of issues reported, resolved, or outstanding, both by our partners and our internal support teams.
Supports large IT projects by completing technical tasks and coordinating with vendors.
Perform monthly reconciliations of SIP bills received from our telecom partners.
Work closely with our Engineering team to assist in setting up, troubleshooting, and remediating local server installations.
Provide user training to ensure they are well-informed about and adhere to the company's IT standards and processes.
Document and/or improve existing IT processes and procedures.
Key details
Location: You'll work from our office in The Gambia.
Work authorization is required in The Gambia.
This is a permanent position.
Our salaries are competitive and calculated using a transparent formula.
We offer generous health insurance for yourself and your dependents.
Airtime reimbursement.
Free food and a beautiful office space.
Requirements
Have a Bachelor's degree in ICT, Computer Science, Engineering, Telecommunications, or equivalent.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in an IT/ Network support desk.
Proficient in French and good command of English.
Knowledge of networks and any SAAS tool.
Experienced in using Google Workspace.
Be flexible with working on weekends or statutory holidays if required.
You might be a good fit if you
Communicate effectively and frequently, both in writing and in person, with a focus on clarity and transparency.
Enjoy networking and meeting new people, and excel at building meaningful relationships.
Embrace new challenges and enjoy finding creative solutions to complex problems.
Possess a strong understanding of networks and systems.
Having a basic understanding of SMS and VOIP/SIP systems would be an advantage.
Are skilled at independently navigating complex relationships.
Adapt quickly and excel in multi-cultural environments.
Are process-driven and capable of implementing structures where it may not exist.
Are exceptionally organized and detail-oriented.
Are focused on user/customer satisfaction and continually strive to improve it.
Approach problems from first principles and think critically about how things should work.
Consider culture and processes from the user's perspective to create the best experience.
Our team
We have a rapidly growing in-country team in Senegal, CÃ´te d'Ivoire, Mali, Burkina Faso, The Gambia, Uganda, Niger, Sierra Leone, and Cameroon plus remote team members spread across the world.
We're deeply passionate about our mission of bringing radically affordable financial services to the people who need them most.
We foster autonomy for our employees. You'll own your projects at every stage, from understanding the problem to monitoring your solution in production.
We raised the largest Series A in Africa in 2021. Our world-class investors, include Founders Fund, Sequoia Heritage, Stripe, Ribbit Capital, Y Combinator, and Partech Africa.
We are onÂ Y Combinator's top companies by revenue.
How to apply
Fill out the form below, and upload a resume in English and aÂ cover letter describing your interest in Wave and the role.
We review applications frequently and recommend that you apply to the role that most closely aligns with your skills, experience and career goals.
Wave is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Junior Administrative Specialist
Description:
Deutsche Gesellschaft fÃ¼r Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) - is a public-benefit federal enterprise working in more than 100 countries worldwide. We work on behalf of the German Government and support public and private sector clients in a wide variety of areas, including economic development and employment, energy and environment, and peace and security. Our activities cover three priority areas: Energy and Climate, which deals with renewable energy and energy efficiency; Training and Sustainable Growth for decent Jobs; and Peaceful and Inclusive Societies, which focuses on good governance.
Project Brief
The Promotion of the Rule of Law and the Judiciary in Africa project aims to enhance access to justice for vulnerable groups, particularly women and economic stakeholders, in CÃ´te dâ€™Ivoire, Ghana, Senegal, and Tanzania. The project focuses on enhancing the capacity of partner organizations to provide tailored, needs-based legal services to vulnerable citizens.
It also seeks to expand the ability of these organizations to offer effective legal services in out-of-court dispute resolution and civil/commercial law for economic stakeholders. Additionally, the project aims to strengthen court systems in partner countries to better support judicial independence and operational efficiency, while also promoting the digitalization of legal information to improve access for both governmental and non-governmental institutions and legal practitioners
Scope Of Role
The Specialist will provide comprehensive financial, administrative, and event management support to ensure the smooth execution of project operations and activities.
You will be responsible for ensuring that all processes comply with GIZ standards and procedures while maintaining an efficient and well-organized office environment.
Key duties include managing documentation, coordinating logistics, and overseeing event and workshop organization.
Additionally, you will play an integral role in facilitating the planning and execution of key meetings, workshops, and project activities.
Tasks
Support the preparation of contracts, verifying completeness and reviewing financial documents from consultants and consulting firms.
Manage daily secretarial tasks and facilitate official correspondence, maintaining professionalism and confidentiality.
Coordinate comprehensive travel logistics for the project team, including travel bookings, hotel accommodations, and reimbursement requests.
Oversee procurement processes, managing inventory and office supplies to ensure operational efficiency.
Assist in the planning and execution of workshops, events, and field missions, ensuring all logistical needs are met.
Ensure adherence to GIZ financial and administrative regulations throughout all project activities.
Support research initiatives on socio-economic issues, compiling relevant data to inform project design and expert assignments.
Maintain accurate project documentation, manage bookkeeping processes, and ensure compliance with GIZ policies and procedures
Qualification Required & Experience
University Degree in Finance, Business Administration or similar
At least 3 years professional experience in a comparable position
Working experience with GIZ, similar development organizations and local government actors is highly desirable
Good working knowledge of IT technologies and computer applications (e.g. MS Office)
Excellent skills in writing and speaking English, knowledge of French will be an asset
Ability to prioritize and deliver assigned tasks diligently under strict deadlines
Willingness to upskill as required by the tasks to be performed â€“ corresponding measures are agreed with management.
Location:
Accra
How To Apply For The Job
Interested and suitable applicants are to forward their Curriculum Vitae (CV) and a one-page cover letter stating their motivation to the position and added value to the project to:
recruitment-ghana@giz.de
quoting the
Job Code 2024/ROL-JAS/28/10
in the subject line. If you do not hear
from us two (2) weeks after the deadline, please consider your application unsuccessful.
Closing Date:
11 November, 2024
GIZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity. All qualified candidates regardless of age, sex, ethnicity, race, and religion are encouraged to apply.

Title: FG Store Officer
Description:
Job Purpose
To manage Finished Goods (FG) inventory efficiently, ensuring accurate stock records, timely dispatches, and compliance with company policies for storage and documentation.
Key Responsibilities:
Maintain accurate records of finished goods in the store.
Ensure proper storage, handling, and preservation of FG as per quality standards.
Monitor stock levels and coordinate with production and dispatch teams for timely replenishment.
Prepare and verify dispatch documents (invoices, delivery notes, etc.).
Conduct regular stock audits and reconcile physical vs. system inventory.
Implement FIFO/FEFO principles for stock movement.
Ensure compliance with safety, hygiene, and company SOPs in the store area.
Liaise with logistics for smooth outbound operations.
Key Requirements:
Education:
Graduate in Commerce / Supply Chain / Logistics or related field.
Experience:
2â€“4 years in store management, preferably in FMCG / manufacturing setup.
Skills:
Knowledge of inventory management systems (SAP / ERP).
Strong organizational and documentation skills.
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
Competencies:
Attention to detail, integrity, teamwork, and problem-solving.
Olam Agri is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Title: Utility Technician
Description:
Role Overview
Responsible for ensuring the efficient operation and maintenance of industrial service equipment in the food industry, including boilers, chillers, compressors, pumps, and fire safety systems. The role requires strong technical expertise, leadership skills, and adherence to safety and regulatory standards.
Key Responsibilities
Perform routine and predictive maintenance on boilers, chillers, compressors, process water systems, vacuum pumps, fire hydrant and fire suppression systems.
Ensure 100% compliance with the Mechanical Preventive Maintenance Plan.
Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to prevent repeat failures.
Collaborate with production and electrical maintenance teams for seamless operations.
Plan daily activities for shift teams, machinists, and welders.
Execute energy-saving and cost-reduction initiatives.
Maintain and manage critical mechanical tools and spare parts inventory.
Liaise with government authorities for statutory compliance and maintain regulatory documentation.
Provide technical support to maintenance technicians and operators.
Ensure workplace safety for self and team, complying with all safety standards.
Requirements & Qualifications
Bachelorâ€™s degree/Diploma in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering.
Minimum 3 years of experience in mechanical engineering within the FMCG industry.
Hands-on experience with industrial service equipment such as boilers, chillers, compressors, pumps, and fire safety systems.
Strong understanding of mechanical engineering principles (mechanics, dynamics, thermodynamics).
Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work under pressure and take ownership of tasks.
Effective time management and personal effectiveness.

Title: Freelance Health and Medical Writer

.
A healthcare-focused educational platform delivering evidence-based medical information and learning resources for nursing, medical, and allied health students, healthcare professionals, and the general public.

This is a full-time remote role for a Freelance Health and Medical Writer. Topics include medical conditions, public health, and patient education. Familiarity with scientific publishing and regulatory requirements is a plus

Title: Accounting Manager, Ghana
Description:
About Zipline
Do you want to change the world? Zipline is on a mission to transform the way goods move. Our aim is to solve the worldâ€™s most urgent and complex access challenges by building, manufacturing and operating the first instant delivery and logistics system that serves all humans equally, wherever they are. From powering Rwandaâ€™s national blood delivery network and Ghanaâ€™s COVID-19 vaccine distribution, to providing on-demand home delivery for Walmart, to enabling healthcare providers to bring care directly to U.S. homes, we are transforming the way things move for businesses, governments and consumers. The technology is complex but the idea is simple: a teleportation service that delivers what you need, when you need it. Through our technology that includes robotics and autonomy, we are decarbonizing delivery, decreasing road congestion, and reducing fossil fuel consumption and air pollution, while providing equitable access to billions of people and building a more resilient global supply chain.
Join Zipline and help us to make good on our promise to build an equitable and more resilient global supply chain for billions of people.
About The Role
The Accounting Manager is a key enabler of Ziplineâ€™s mission, ensuring the financial integrity, compliance, and discipline that drive sustainable growth. This role upholds accurate accounting, strong controls, clean audits, IFRS compliance, and effective cash managementâ€”safeguarding the trust of regulators, partners, donors, and the communities we serve. By maintaining financial excellence, the Accounting Manager makes Ziplineâ€™s life-saving operations possible today and as we scale across Ghana and Africa.
What You'll Do In This Role
Oversee Daily Accounting Operations
Manage and supervise all day-to-day accounting activities including general ledger updates, bank reconciliations, expense management, and financial entries.
Ensure timely, accurate recording of transactions in line with company policies and IFRS/local GAAP.
Implement and Strengthen Internal Controls
Develop, document, and enforce strong internal control procedures to safeguard company assets.
Identify control weaknesses, recommend improvements, and ensure compliance with audit requirements.
Lead the Month-End Close Process
Coordinate and execute a timely and accurate month-end closing cycle.
Manage Statutory, Tax, and External/Internal Audits
Act as the primary contact for auditors for the Ghana entity.
Prepare audit schedules, support documentation, and ensure prompt resolution of audit queries.
Ensure all statutory filings, annual financial statements, and regulatory submissions are completed on time.
Support Procurement and Accounts Payable Processes
Collaborate with procurement and accounts payable teams to improve vendor relationships and payment cycles.
Review and Approve Journal Entries
Validate accuracy, completeness, and correct coding of journal entries before posting.
Ensure all journal entries are properly supported and comply with accounting standards.
Manage Accounts Receivable and Credit Control
Monitor customer accounts, invoicing, collections, and aging reports.
Collaborate with sales and operations teams to resolve disputes and improve cash inflows.
Ensure Tax and Regulatory Compliance
Manage accurate and timely filing of VAT, PAYE, corporate tax, withholding tax, and other statutory deductions.
Stay updated with Ghana Revenue Authority (GRA) requirements and ensure full compliance.
Maintain accurate documentation to support tax audits and regulatory inspections.
Balance Sheet & Profit & Loss (P&L) Management
Review and analyze monthly balance sheet and P&L performance.
Investigate variances, trends, and provide actionable insights to management.
Ensure proper reconciliation and accuracy of all balance sheet accounts.
Prepare Quarterly Cash Flow Forecasts
Develop reliable short- and medium-term cash flow projections for Ghana operations.
Identify opportunities to optimize cash usage, collections, and payment terms.
Cross-Functional Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement
Work closely with HR, Operations, Procurement, Supply Chain, and Global Finance teams.
Provide financial insights to support decision-making and business strategies.
Participate in regional finance meetings and contribute to process improvements and system enhancements.
What You'll Bring
A degree in Finance/Accounting.
At least 5 to 7 years progressive experience in finance.
Strong understanding of accounting principles and financial reporting standards.
Excellent knowledge of tax regulations, VAT, WHT, PAYE, GRA guidelines.
Strong understanding and experience in Financial auditing.
What Else You Need To Know
Zipline is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other characteristics protected by state, federal or local law or our other policies.
We value diversity at Zipline and welcome applications from those who are traditionally underrepresented in tech. If you like the sound of this position but are not sure if you are the perfect fit, please apply!
Please Note
We have received reports stating that certain individuals are reaching out to people under false pretenses, claiming to be Zipline employees, affiliates, agents, or representatives. They may seek to gain access to your personal information or to acquire money from you by offering fictitious employment opportunities or by claiming that they are contacting you on Ziplineâ€™s behalf.
Genuine Zipline employees or representatives will never ask you for money or payment in exchange for employment opportunities or other related services. Any such offer of employment or any other service in exchange for fees that claims to be from us is deceitful and part of a fraud.
If you believe you have been targeted by a fraudulent party, we ask that you immediately get in touch with us via email at
security@flyzipline.com
upon receiving a suspicious offer or claim.
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

Title: Principal Program Manager - Enterprise Endpoint Security - join the best!
Description:
This prime opportunity with Symantec's successful Enterprise compliance and endpoint security team requires the top talent to accomplish complex program management.  We need people who thoroughly understand the challenges of developing commercial software products to release.
In this role you will own delivery of one or more typically high risk, large scope and/or complicated projects. You will create and own project master schedule optimizing for project specific priorities. You will lead the team through the product lifecycle working with peer functional managers (Product Management, Development, and QA) to continuously manage trade-offs between features, resources and schedule. Your acumen will uncover, manage and resolve project interdependencies and proactively manage risks. You will be the central communicator  and facilitator for the project team. Your technical and business savvy will anticipate and solve problems related to project issues.
This role requires 6 + years experience in commercial software project management, additional management experience preferred. Thorough understanding of project/product life cycle and experience leading at least 1 full release cycle of a commercial software product. Strong project estimation, organization, scheduling and planning skills. Working knowledge of a variety of project management tools. Strong ability to solve complex problems where in-depth analysis and evaluation of various factors is required, deal with high degree of ambiguity, and maintain composure in stressful confrontational situations. Ability to motivate and influence internal and external project team members to establish team cohesion are key attributes of a successful candidate!
You can be successful if you have the skills which also include: attention to detail, accuracy, action oriented, taking charge skills, priority setting, quick study, accountability, dealing with ambiguity, composure in stressful confrontational situations, great project planning and organizational skills, creative approach to problem-solving, motivating others, active listening and presentation skills, interpersonal savvy, conflict management, negotiation skills, and perseverance
Bachelor's degree (preferably BSCS or similar); PMI or similar certification or experience preferred.
Symantec is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes diversity.
We also invite you to complete a voluntary self disclosure by clicking on the link below:
http://www.symantec.com/about/careers/index.jsp.
Thank you for considering Symantec Corporation with your next career move.

Title: ChargÃ©e de Programmes (Program Officer)
Description:
Company Description
OUSKEI Academy trains and empowers the next generation of scientists, engineers, and innovators in Guinea by offering hands-on, action-based learning opportunities. Participants not only develop technical skills but also foster creativity, critical thinking, teamwork, and an innovative mindset. Since 2018, OUSKEI Academy has proudly represented Guinea in nine international robotics and digital technology competitions across the globe. With over 467 youth trained, 30% of whom are women, and 25+ partner schools, OUSKEI Academy has made itself a key player in advancing STEM education and innovation in Guinea. The organization actively collaborates with global partners, including FIRST Global and AI for Good, to ensure inclusive and impactful programs.
Role Description
This is a part-time on-site role located in Ratoma for a Program Officer at OUSKEI Academy. The Program Officer will be responsible for managing and implementing educational programs, including planning, execution, and evaluation. Key responsibilities include liaising with partners, mentoring participants, conducting training sessions, providing guidance, and delivering high-quality client and participant service. The role will also involve analyzing program effectiveness and reporting progress to stakeholders.
Qualifications
Competency in Program Management and ability to oversee program implementation and evaluation
Strong Analytical Skills to assess program effectiveness and identify areas for improvement
Excellent Communication skills for effective interaction with teams, participants, and external partners
Proficiency in conducting Training sessions and facilitating learning
Commitment to providing excellent Customer Service in both internal and external interactions
Experience in the educational or STEM field is an advantage
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Education, Management, or a related field

Title: Business System Analyst Trainee
Company: FilPass ( A Company of BEfied Group)
Location: Worldwide Mission, Grand Bassa County, Liberia
Description:
The Business System Analyst (BSA) Trainee will support the end-to-end process of translating business needs into technical requirements. This role bridges the gap between stakeholders and the development team by documenting business processes, creating user stories, and visualizing workflows. The trainee will also assist in building interactive mockups and supporting system documentation through modern tools like Jira, Confluence, and Figma.
Responsibilities
Gather and document business and system requirements through meetings and user interviews.
Create and refine user stories, acceptance criteria, and workflow documentation.
Collaborate with developers and QA to ensure requirements are clearly understood and implemented.
Develop flowcharts, wireframes, and mockups in Figma to visualize system processes.
Utilize Jira for sprint planning, issue tracking, and progress monitoring.
Maintain and update Confluence pages for project documentation and knowledge sharing.
Conduct research and benchmarking to identify opportunities for process or system improvement.
Support testing efforts by validating requirements and reviewing test results.
Assist in preparing user manuals, reports, and presentations for internal stakeholders.
Perform other assigned tasks related to system analysis and documentation.
Requirements
Currently pursuing a Bachelors/College Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, or related field.
Knowledge or hands-on experience with Jira, Confluence, and Figma.
Basic understanding of front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and documentation skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Interest in business analysis, systems design, and process improvement.
Graduating students are preferred.
Benefits
Remote, work-from-home setup.
Tamper-proof Certificate of Completion.
Full-time job opportunity for top-performing interns.
Completion bonus upon successful internship.

Title: Head of Product (Muslima)
Location: Worldwide Mission, Grand Bassa County, Liberia
Description:
Social Discovery Group
(SDG) is the 3rd largest social discovery company in the world, uniting 60+ brands with 500 million users. We solve the problems of loneliness, isolation, and disconnection by transforming virtual intimacy into the new normal. Our portfolio includes online communication platforms focusing on AI, game mechanics, and video streaming - Dating.com, DateMyAge, Cupid Media, Dil Mil, Kiseki, and others.
SDG invests in IT startups around the world.
Our investments include Open AI, Patreon, Flo, Clubhouse, Woebot, Flure, Astry, Coursera, Academia.edu, and many others.
We bring together a team of like-minded people and IT professionals specializing in the creation and development of globally impactful social discovery products. Our international team of 1200 professionals and digital nomads works all over the world.
Our teams of digital nomads
work remotely from
Cyprus, Malta, the USA, Armenia, Georgia, Kazakhstan, Montenegro, Poland, Latvia, Serbia, Spain, Portugal, UAE, Israel, Turkey, Thailand, Indonesia, Japan, Hong Kong, Australia and many other locations.
In August 2024, we achieved
Great Place to Work US Certificationâ„¢!
This achievement reflects our core belief that a truly exceptional workplace is built on trust, pride, and camaraderieâ€”not just great perks.
We are looking for a Head of Product (Muslima)
.
Your Main Tasks Will Be
Define & Execute Product Strategy: Develop and prioritize the product roadmap to align with business goals and user needs, ensuring continuous platform growth.
User & Market Research: Conduct research (user surveys, feedback, industry trends) to gather insights and identify opportunities for new features and improvements.
Feature Development & Prioritization: Lead the development of new features (e.g., enhanced matching, privacy tools) and manage the product backlog to deliver high-impact updates.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with design, engineering, marketing, and customer support teams to ensure seamless execution of product features and initiatives.
User Experience Optimization: Ensure the platform is intuitive and engaging by collaborating with UX/UI designers to improve user flows and conduct A/B tests.
Data Analysis & Performance Monitoring: Track key metrics (e.g., user engagement, subscriptions) and analyze data to optimize features and drive growth.
Safety & Trust: Focus on building features that enhance user safety, such as reporting tools and verification systems, to create a trusted environment.
Monetization Strategy: Develop and optimize subscription models and pricing strategies to drive revenue while ensuring value for users.
Customer Support & Feedback Loop: Address user feedback, resolve pain points, and work with support teams to improve the overall user experience.
We Expect From You
English (fluent), Russian (fluent/native) - knowledge of Russian will be a strong advantage
Market Research: Skills in conducting market analysis and competitive analysis to understand the market landscape, customer needs, and opportunities for innovation.
Product management: user journey, product lifecycle, ability to define and manage a product roadmap, prioritize features and tasks based on business goals, user needs, and technical feasibility.
Data analysis: data analytics tools (Superset, Tableau, Excel, Google Sheets) to gather insights on product performance, customer usage, and behavior. Strong skills in defining, tracking, and interpreting KPIs. The knowledge of how to analyze different types of data.
Project management: agile frameworks (e.g., Scrum, Kanban), Jira, Confluence, GITHUB to manage the backlog, sprints, and workflows, management of timelines, resource allocation,
Knowledge of UX/UI principles and expertise in conducting user research (surveys, interviews, usability testing) and analyzing data to inform product decisions and identify user pain points.
Knowledge of marketing principles and dependencies of marketing metrics
Understanding of different pricing models, subscription systems, and monetization strategies to drive revenue while ensuring user value.
Expertise in managing the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to launch, and ensuring continuous iteration and improvement post-launch.
What Do We Offer
REMOTE OPPORTUNITY to work full time;
Vacation 28 calendar days per year;
7 wellness days per year (time off) that can be used to deal with household issues, to lie down and recover without taking sick leave;
Bonuses up to $5000 for recommending successful applicants for positions in the company;
50% payment for professional training, international conferences and meetings;
Corporate discount for English lessons;
Health benefits. According to the paychecks, if you are not eligible for corporate medical insurance, the company will compensate you with up to $ 1,000 gross per year per employee. This can be spent on self-purchase of health insurance or on doctorâ€™s fees for yourself and close relatives (spouse, children);
Workplace organization. The company provides all employees with an equipped workplace and all the necessary equipment (table, armchair, wifi, etc.) in our offices or co-working locations. In the other locations, the company provides reimbursement of workplace costs up to $1000 gross once every 3 years, according to the paychecks. This money can be spent on the rent of the co-working room, on equipping the working place at home (desk, chair, Internet, etc.) during those 3 years;
Internal gamified gratitude system: receive bonuses from colleagues and exchange them for our merchandise, team building activities, massage certificates, etc.
Sounds good? Join us now!

Title: Director, People Operations (Liberia)
Description:
Last Mile Healthâ€™s offices will be closed from December 25 to January 2 for our annual end-of-year break. During this period, application reviews and candidate communications will be delayed. We appreciate your patience and encourage you to apply as usual â€” our team will resume the recruitment process once we return in January.
This role was posted on November 12, 2025. Please note that we will review applications on a rolling basis.
The Role
At Last Mile Health (LMH), we obsess about exceptional work. Do you have a passion for building strong, people-centered organizations and leading HR operations that empower teams to thrive? Are you skilled at turning people strategies into practical systems that drive engagement, performance, and organizational growth? If so, you may be the next Director, People Operations in Liberia.
The Director, People Operations (Liberia) is a hands-on, strategic people leader responsible for driving excellence across all core HR functions in alignment with Last Mile Healthâ€™s strategic objectives. This role provides strategic business partnership to departmental managers and teams, ensuring that People Operations is a trusted and effective partner in achieving organizational goals.
The Director will lead the Liberia People Operations team, reporting to the Country Director, Liberia. They will be responsible for designing and implementing key HR operational functionsâ€”including administration and compliance, talent acquisition, learning and development, and employee engagementâ€”while contributing to broader people strategies in partnership with the Global People Operations team.
The Director will develop a deep understanding of our people and culture, implementing creative and data-informed talent solutions that enhance performance, strengthen engagement, and foster a positive employee experience. As the go-to people leader for LMH Liberia, the Director will provide strategic advice and operational excellence at the intersection of strategy, execution, and culture.
This position is only open to candidates who are currently located and authorized to work in Liberia. This role is onsite and located in Monrovia, Liberia.
What youâ€™ll do
HR Administration and Compliance
Ensure talent practices are compliant with relevant laws, Liberian regulations, and internal policies through effective communication and monitoring of all policies.
Plan, direct, and supervise all activities relating to the administration and maintenance of payroll and employee benefits programs.
Lead and supervise daily administration of HR services with the People Operations team, including promotions, transfers, contract management and administration, performance management, leave administration, and employee relations in accordance with quality management principles and overall objectives of Last Mile Health.
Lead and partner with others on investigations and disciplinary reviews.
Develop, prepare, generate, and analyze ongoing and ad-hoc reports pertaining to employee personnel information and data, including issues such as benefits costs, turnover, recruitment, compensation, promotions, etc.
Effectively utilize the HR Information system to obtain, store, and analyze pertinent data and information.
Ensure proper record keeping and tracking of personnel files and government filings.
Oversee and enhance the work of the People Operations team in Liberia.
Serve as lead liaison with Liberia Legal counsel and proactively reduce potential risk to the organization
Talent Acquisition
Partner with hiring managers and the Global Talent Acquisition team to develop effective sourcing and recruitment strategies that result in hiring manager and candidate engagement and satisfaction.
Collaborate with the Global Talent Acquisition team to build a diverse, values-aligned, and high-performing workforce through sourcing strategies and targeted attraction strategies.
Ensure talent acquisition practices are in line with LMH's global talent acquisition policies and standards.
Evaluate and provide insights on LMH recruitment standards and best practices to hiring managers and interview teams.
Supervise the People Operations team and lead full-cycle recruitment process for open positions in Liberia while working with hiring managers to fully scope roles, source and screen candidates, build and implement custom selection processes, and offer roles to finalists.
Learning and Development
Partnering with the Learning and Development team leads to identifying individual and team-wide learning and development needs.
Identify and leverage internal and external resources to develop the technical skills of assigned teams, in partnership with global Learning & Development team members.
Support managers to lead high-quality and agile performance management systems, including regular goal-setting and review, meaningful coaching, and performance assessment.
Employee Engagement
Build a deep understanding of individual team cultures, including building evidence through observation, data collection, and engagement.
Collaborating with and coach team leads to improve leadership and team culture.
Partner with global People Operations to identify and act on org-wide retention and culture trends, opportunities, and risks.
What You'll Bring
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or similar discipline, or related experience.
Progressive experience in leading and overseeing an HR function.
Significant experience in high-growth environments and helping to implement initiatives.
Significant professional experience in the social sector, with working knowledge of the international development space.
Comprehensive knowledge of human resources standards and practices, especially as relate to policy development and implementation, standards for confidentiality and reporting, and conflict resolution
Excellent judgment around personal relations and the ability to cultivate a warm and welcoming environment
Strong project management skills
Ability to produce solutions to complex problems in a user-friendly manner
Ability to navigate complex processes and problem-solve to negotiate and achieve consensus with multiple influencers.
HR generalist experience in all areas of Human Resources Management, including compensation and benefits, HR compliance, talent management, talent acquisition, and organizational culture.
Youâ€™ll Impress Us If
You have experience using an HR Information System and an applicant tracking system, preferably JazzHR
You have SHRM-CP or another related certification
You have prior experience as a full-cycle HR business partner
Compensation Information
At Last Mile Health, we strive to reward our employees equitably and transparently. This means that we pay our employees based on a clear and consistent methodology and without regard to their identity or personal relationships. We have made this model fully transparent so that everyone has access to all information related to compensation. We hope this helps you better understand Last Mile Healthâ€™s values and commitments to our employees. We look forward to answering any questions you may have during the hiring process.
Overview Of Last Mile Healthâ€™s Compensation Model
Before applying to this role, please take a moment to learn more about our approach to compensation and how compensation works in each of the countries where we operate. Please find the link to our compensation model and benefits overview below:
Compensation For This Position
The Band for this position: LBR-4
For Liberia, the range is $46,106 - $68,174 USD, depending upon experience doing an equivalent role. Please note that this compensation is subject to statutory taxes.
About Last Mile Health
Last Mile Health partners with governments to design, scale, strengthen, and sustain high-quality community health systems, which empower teams of community and frontline health workers to bring life-saving primary healthcare to the worldâ€™s most remote communities. LMH is a registered 501(c)3 non-profit organization. For more information, visit www.lastmilehealth.org.
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at LMH. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

Position Summary
Our jobs arenâ€™t just about giving guests a smooth check-in and check-out. Instead, we want to build and experience that is memorable and unique. Our Guest Experience Experts take the initiative to deliver a wide range of services that guide guests through their entire stay. They are empowered to move about their space and do what needs to be done. Whether processing operational needs, addressing guest requests, completing reports, or sharing the highlights of the local area, the Guest Experience Expert makes transactions feel like part of the experience.
No matter what position you are in, there are a few things that are critical to success â€“ creating a safe work place, following company policies and procedures, maintaining confidentiality, protecting company assets, upholding quality standards, and ensuring your uniform, personal appearance, and communications are professional. Guest Experience Experts will be on their feet and moving around (stand, sit, or walk for an extended time) and taking a hands-on approach to work (move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance). Doing all these things well (and other reasonable job duties as requested) is critical for Guest Experience Experts â€“ to get it right for our guests and our business each and every time.
Preferred Qualifications
Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.
Related Work Experience: No related work experience.
Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.
License or Certification: None

Title: Chief Revenue Officer
Description:
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Chief Revenue Officer in Nigeria.
In this executive role, you will lead and unify all revenue-generating functions, including Sales, Marketing, Partner Management, Client Success, and Account Management, under a single strategic vision. Reporting directly to the CEO, you will drive predictable growth through disciplined pipeline management, data-driven decision-making, and strong customer and partner relationships. You will serve as a key advisor to the leadership team, shaping commercial strategy, pricing, and go-to-market initiatives. This position offers the opportunity to influence the entire revenue engine of a high-growth, dynamic organization while mentoring top-performing teams and fostering cross-functional collaboration. The role is remote-first and requires strategic vision, operational excellence, and strong leadership in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
Accountabilities
Develop and implement a unified revenue strategy across sales, marketing, partner channels, and client success to maximize growth and profitability
Set measurable revenue targets, KPIs, and operating processes to ensure predictable and scalable performance
Lead the end-to-end sales organization, including strategy execution, pipeline management, forecasting, and quota attainment
Oversee marketing and demand-generation efforts to build brand presence, generate qualified leads, and support revenue growth
Drive partner ecosystem development, cultivating high-performing referral, reseller, and strategic alliances
Ensure client success and account management functions deliver strong retention, expansion, and satisfaction outcomes
Establish disciplined revenue operations, dashboards, and reporting frameworks to monitor performance, identify risks, and optimize outcomes
Mentor and develop direct reports and cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration and high performance
Requirements
Proven executive experience leading revenue-generating functions, ideally as a CRO, CMO, or SVP of Sales/Marketing
Track record of scaling B2B services or technology revenue and achieving predictable growth
Deep expertise in pipeline management, revenue operations, forecasting, and data-driven decision-making
Experience implementing repeatable processes across sales, partner, and client success teams to drive retention and expansion
Demonstrated ability to hire, develop, and retain high-performing go-to-market teams
Strong business acumen, strategic thinking, and executive presence to influence CEO, board, and leadership stakeholders
Excellent analytical, communication, and stakeholder management skills
Comfortable leading in a remote-first, cross-functional, and fast-paced environment
Benefits
Competitive executive compensation aligned with experience, skills, and results
Remote-first work environment with flexibility across time zones
Opportunity to lead and shape a high-growth, mission-driven organization
Professional development, leadership growth, and cross-functional exposure
Collaborative and inclusive team culture
Comprehensive benefits package tailored to local standards
Why Apply Through Jobgether?
We use an
AI-powered matching process
to ensure your application is reviewed quickly, objectively, and fairly against the role's core requirements. Our system identifies the top-fitting candidates, and this shortlist is then shared directly with the hiring company. The final decision and next steps (interviews, assessments) are managed by their internal team.
We appreciate your interest and wish you the best!
Why Apply Through Jobgether?
Data Privacy Notice:
By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Jobgether will process your personal data to evaluate your candidacy and share relevant information with the hiring employer. This processing is based on legitimate interest and pre-contractual measures under applicable data protection laws (including GDPR). You may exercise your rights (access, rectification, erasure, objection) at any time.
We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

Title: Vice President of Marketing
Description:
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Vice President of Marketing in Nigeria.
In this role, you will lead the development and execution of a high-impact marketing strategy that drives growth, brand awareness, and customer engagement. You will oversee a team of marketing professionals, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams including product, sales, finance, and legal. Your work will directly influence business performance, leveraging data-driven insights to optimize campaigns and drive measurable results. This position offers the opportunity to shape marketing strategy in a dynamic, fast-growing environment, balancing creativity, analytics, and strategic leadership. The ideal candidate thrives in a collaborative, remote-first culture and is passionate about scaling businesses and elevating customer experiences.
Accountabilities
Develop and implement innovative, data-driven marketing campaigns to attract, engage, and retain customers
Lead overall marketing strategy and growth plans, prioritizing scalable initiatives that drive measurable business impact
Partner with Finance to forecast, monitor, and optimize the marketing budget, ensuring maximum ROI
Manage omnichannel marketing efforts, constantly iterating and testing strategies for optimal performance
Build and maintain reporting frameworks to measure marketing effectiveness, extracting actionable insights
Collaborate with Sales and Product teams to ensure alignment of messaging, campaigns, and conversion strategies
Monitor industry trends and competitor activity to inform strategy and identify new opportunities
Requirements
7+ years of experience leading marketing functions, ideally in fintech, real estate, or mortgage sectors
Proven track record in scaling businesses through effective marketing strategy and execution
Experience managing $15M+ annual marketing budgets with strong ROI focus
Strong business acumen, strategic mindset, and ability to align departmental goals with organizational objectives
Excellent analytical skills, including performance tracking, forecasting, reporting, and presentation of data to leadership
Deep knowledge of homeowner acquisition, engagement, and retention strategies, including digital marketing, SEO, SEM, email marketing, and analytics
Skilled in marketing tools and platforms, such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud, marketing automation tools, analytics dashboards, and ad platforms
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with ability to present ideas and data compellingly
Adaptability to fast-changing priorities and collaborative, remote-first work environments
Benefits
Competitive salary range of $250,000â€“$300,000, inclusive of base pay and performance-based bonus
Remote-first work environment with flexibility and autonomy
Opportunity to lead marketing strategy in a high-growth, impact-driven organization
Professional development opportunities and exposure to cross-functional leadership
Collaborative, inclusive, and supportive team culture
Comprehensive benefits package tailored to local standards
Why Apply Through Jobgether?
We use an
AI-powered matching process
to ensure your application is reviewed quickly, objectively, and fairly against the role's core requirements. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best!

Company Description
Don't miss out!

Training is Free
