Title: Patent Paralegal (Permanent)
Description:
Leeds , Bath or Cardiff | Hybrid Working | Full-Time
Ready to level up your Paralegal career?
At EIP, weâ€™re more than just a tier-one patent firm - weâ€™re a team that celebrates curiosity, collaboration, and career development. You'll work alongside attorneys to drive the progress of client portfolios, applying your knowledge of IP procedures to manage tasks proactively and ensure deadlines are met. Your ability to manage processes confidently and efficiently will be key to your success.
What weâ€™re looking for?
Weâ€™re looking for someone whoâ€™s proactive, organised, and ready to make an impact. Youâ€™ll bring:
Minimum 2+ yearsâ€™ experience in a patent paralegal role
Completed the Introductory Patent Paralegal Course (IPPC)
Strong understanding of patent processes and procedures
Experience using Inprotech or similar patent databases
Familiarity with document management systems
Confident communication skills and a positive, can-do attitude
A collaborative mindset and keen attention to detail
What sets us apart?
EIP is an award-winning patent practice known for handling high-value, complex patent matters. With offices across the UK, Germany, Sweden, and the US, we combine global reach with a collaborative, forward-thinking culture where innovation, inclusion, and teamwork thrive.
We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including private medical insurance and flexible and hybrid working arrangements to support your wellbeing and work-life balance. Weâ€™re also deeply committed to diversity and inclusion - proud supporters of the IP Inclusive initiative and signatories to the IP Inclusive Charter.
Ready to Apply?
If you're passionate about patents and thrive in a fast-paced legal environment, weâ€™d love to hear from you!

Title: Caregiver
Company: Le Groupe Angelcare â”ƒ Angelcare Group
Description:
We are seeking compassionate and dedicated Caregiver from Africa and other eligible countries to join our team in Ireland. Our organization is committed to supporting you with visa sponsorship to make a rewarding career in the Ireland possible.
As a Caregiver, you will play an essential role in providing person-centered care to our clients, helping them maintain independence and dignity in their day-to-day lives. This position offers an excellent opportunity for individuals with a passion for helping others to gain valuable experience in Ireland,s healthcare sector.
Tasks
-Provide high-quality personal care and assistance to clients in their daily activities, including bathing, dressing, feeding, and mobility support.
-Administer medication and monitor client health, ensuring any changes are promptly reported.
-Assist clients with household tasks, including meal preparation, laundry, and light housekeeping.
-Provide companionship, emotional support, and encouragement to clients, fostering a positive environment.
-Maintain accurate records of client care, activities, and any incidents.
-Communicate effectively with clients, families, and healthcare professionals to ensure seamless care.
Requirements
-Prior experience in caregiving, nursing, or healthcare support is preferred but not mandatory; training will be provided.
-A genuine desire to help and improve the lives of others.
-Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
-Physical ability to handle various care tasks, including lifting or supporting clients.
-Willingness to work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays as needed.
-A valid passport
Benefits
-Visa Sponsorship
-free flightsand accomodation

Title: Salaried Financial Advisor
Description:
Let's Write Africa's Story Together!
Old Mutual is a firm believer in the African opportunity and our diverse talent reflects this.
Job Description
na
Provides advice on a specific range of products to a specific allocated market and are individually accountable for achieving results through their own efforts.
Responsibilities
Customer Service
Provide a quality service to customers while identifying opportunities to secure new business or support retention. Responsibilities may include processing cases, dealing with complex queries, and investigating and resolving customer problems.
Solutions Analysis
Analyze specific problems and issues to find the best solutions. Solutions could be technical or professional in nature.
Receiving Visitors
Receive visitors and assist with various requests for information, referring more complex matters to colleagues.
Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Data
Schedule follow-up actions and enter relevant information into the CRM system after each contact with a customer to create a call plan and to ensure that the organization has quality data to enable effective customer retention and business development activities.
Customer Needs Clarification
Set clear objectives for each sales call or meeting; tailor standard materials to make presentations to decision-makers and influencers within the customer organization; and ask relevant questions to gather information, to evaluate the customer's level of interest, and to identify and respond to areas requiring further information or explanation.
Customer Relationship Development / Prospecting
Develop and implement a relationship management plan for potential customer accounts to identify and build relationships with relevant decision-makers and influencers within the customer organization and to enable effective two-way flow of information and resolution of issues.
Operational Compliance
Develop knowledge and understanding of the organization's policies and procedures and of relevant regulatory codes and codes of conduct to ensure own work adheres to those standards. Obtain authorization from a supervisor or manager for any exceptions from mandatory procedure.
Business Development
Monitor and assess sales and market data for a specific geographic region that will assist management in identifying areas in the market where business can be developed.
Sales Opportunities Creation
Develop a personal network within the business sector and represent the organization at business sector events. Obtain market intelligence and enhance the visibility and reputation of the organization, its products, and its services.
Data Exploration
Conduct research and select relevant information to enable analysis of key themes and trends using primary data sources and business intelligence tools.
Network of Influence
Demonstrate understanding of the value of networking by participating in and contributing to a network of people, technologies, and ideas both inside and outside the company.
Requirements: Skills, Qualifications and Experience required
Grade 12 (Matric).
Valid Driverâ€™s licence and Own Car
FAIS Compliance
Clear criminal and credit check
Minimum of 3 years working experience (preferably in sales)
Computer literacy (MS Word, Powerpoint and Outlook)
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Presentations skills an added advantage
Skills
Building Trust, Consultative Selling, Customer-Focused, Customer Service, Customer Understanding, Direct Selling, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Oral Communications, Probing Questions, Qualifying Prospects, Sales Data Management, Sales Software, Strategic Selling, Strengthening Customer Relationships
Competencies
Action Oriented
Balances Stakeholders
Builds Networks
Collaborates
Communicates Effectively
Customer Focus
Drives Results
Ensures Accountability
Education
NQF Level 5 - Higher, Advance or Occupational Certificate or equivalent
Closing Date
30 December 2025 , 23:59
The appointment will be made from the designated group in line with the Employment Equity Plan of Old Mutual South Africa and the specific business unit in question.
Old Mutual Limited is pro-vaccination and encourages its workforce to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19.
All prospective employees are required to disclose their vaccination status as part of the recruitment process.
Please refer to the Old Mutualâ€™s Covid-19 vaccination policy for further detail. Kindly note that Old Mutual reserves the right to reinstate the requirement to vaccinate at any point if it is of the view that it is imperative to do so.
The Old Mutual Story!

Skills

Title: Service Engineer - Relocate to the Netherlands.
Description:
Position Title:
Service Engineer - Relocate to the Netherlands.
Position Type:
Regular - Full-Time
Requisition ID:
36373
Ready to take your maintenance skills global? Join Van Geloven in the Netherlands!
About Van Geloven
Van Geloven is a leading Dutch producer of well-known snack products enjoyed across Europe. With multiple production sites, we manage the full snack production process, from ingredient preparation and assembly to freezing and packaging, using both manual and automated systems. Weâ€™re proud of our dynamic work environment, innovative technology, and strong focus on quality and reliability.
About The Role
As a Service Engineer at Van Geloven, your primary responsibility is to keep our production lines and installations running smoothly and efficiently. Youâ€™ll perform corrective and preventive maintenance, analyze faults, and contribute to technical improvement projects. Your expertise in both electrical and mechanical engineering will be crucial in reducing downtime and optimizing machine performance.
You will work in a structured and flexible environment, collaborating closely with colleagues while also managing your own tasks. Youâ€™ll document your work clearly, follow safety protocols, and be a key player in maintaining a safe and effective production process.
Relocation Support (From South Africa)
Are you living in South Africa and ready for an exciting new career in the Netherlands? Van Geloven offers full relocation support for you and your family, including:
Orientation week in the Netherlands: After two video interviews via Teams, you will be invited to visit the Netherlands for an orientation week. You'll meet your future colleagues, connect with our relocation partner (P&D-Care), tour the city, and view potential homes.
Relocation assistance: We guide you through all practical matters including insurance registration, municipal enrollment, and residence permit applications.
All travel covered: Van Geloven pays for the orientation trip (including your partnerâ€™s travel) and your final move to the Netherlands.
Household move arranged: We handle the shipping of your household items and furniture.
Temporary housing covered: Your first two months of housing in the Netherlands, including gas, water, electricity, and internet, are fully paid by Van Geloven.
Relocation allowance: Provided in accordance with Dutch tax regulations.
Tax support: Through our partner, we also provide support with your first yearâ€™s tax return and related matters.
Dutch language course: A Dutch language course is offered for you and your family to support your integration.
What We Offer
When you join Van Geloven, you are hired directly on contract and enjoy a competitive salary and extensive benefits. During the orientation week, we will explain the full employment package in detail with the help of P&D Care, to ensure a clear understanding of what the Dutch conditions mean in practice.
Who You Are
You are an experienced maintenance technician with strong knowledge of both electrical and mechanical systems. Speaking and reading Afrikaans is a must. You're open to relocating, learning a new language, and starting a new life in the Netherlands with the full support of our team.
Ready for the next step?
If you're based in South Africa and interested in moving to the Netherlands with excellent support and benefits, apply today!
We look forward to welcoming you to Van Geloven, and to the Netherlands.
Van Geloven is an equal opportunity employer. All backgrounds welcome.
McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer. As a global family-owned company, we strive to be the employer of choice in the diverse communities around the world in which we live and work. We recognize that inclusion drives our creativity, resilience, and success and makes our business stronger. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.
McCain is an accessible employer. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms), please
let us know
and we will work with you to find appropriate solutions.
Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us, you agree this will be handled in accordance with McCainâ€™s
Global Privacy Policy
and
Global Employee Privacy Policy
, as applicable. You can understand how your personal information is being handled
here
.

Title: Substitute Custodians
Description:
Location
Custodial Services
Reference #
n/a
Close Date
open until filled
Location
Custodial Services
Reference #
n/a
Close Date
open until filled
Summary
Davis School District is hiring substitute custodians. (The part-time custodian positions are filled by current approved substitute custodians).
Description
Davis School District is looking for positive, hard-working people to help us take care of our buildings! The job consists of vacuuming, sweeping, cleaning windows, and emptying garbage cans. Age requirement is 16 years old or older. Substitute Custodians are paid $13.90 per hour. The way our system works is quite simple. First, we hire each applicant as a substitute, then we will take you through simple training to prepare you for your first shift at a school. Once you are trained and find a school that you love, you will be asked to fill in for a school custodian where needed. An opportunity like this may give you the experience necessary to be considered for a part-time position and that wage goes up! There are many part-time positions that we need to fill quite often. We also have an awesome training program in place with tons of opportunities to move up within the district. If you'd rather not join us as a part-time employee, staying on as a substitute is just fine too! We're flexible. If this sounds like something you'd be interested in, give us a call, or just submit your application and we will give you a call. We can't wait to work with you!

Title: Finance Administrator
Description:
Finance Administrator â€“ Pretoria
Job Summary
We are seeking a detail-oriented Finance Administrator to manage payroll processing, statutory submissions, invoicing, financial reporting, and tender administration. Accuracy, compliance, and confidentiality are essential for this role.
Responsibilities
Payroll Administration:
Process payroll calculations including salaries, overtime, deductions, and statutory contributions.
Maintain payroll records, employee data, leave balances, and absences.
Reconcile payroll accounts and prepare internal payroll reports.
Load monthly payroll on the bank and submit EMP201, EMP501, UI19, and WCA (WCN) returns.
Ensure confidentiality and legislative compliance at all times.
Invoicing & Financial Administration:
Prepare monthly invoices and allocate payments.
Capture purchase orders, credit notes, and statements.
Follow up on outstanding invoices weekly.
Prepare VAT submissions, monthly financial statements, budgets, expenditure, and management reports.
Tender Administration:
Compile and submit tender documentation.
Maintain internal compliance records.
Qualifications & Experience
National Diploma in Payroll, Finance, Accounting, or HR.
3â€“5 yearsâ€™ relevant experience in payroll and finance administration.
Experience using Sage Accounting (essential).
Experience with payroll systems (SimplePay ) and MS Excel.
Experience with SARS eFiling, including EMP501 submissions.
Sound knowledge of UIF and statutory reporting requirements.
Benefits
Retirement Annuity
Medical Plan
Gym Membership

Assist in defining and documenting user requirements and product specifications for new initiatives.
Conduct customer research and analyze customer feedback to identify pain points and opportunities for product improvement.
Conduct market research to understand emerging trends and competitive landscapes in loyalty and subscription services.
Monitor customer behavior and subscription metrics to identify areas for performance improvement.
Present data-driven insights to the team to guide strategic decision-making.
Support the rollout of A/B tests to validate feature releases or improvements.
Help validate and test new features for takealotMORE across platforms (web, app, etc.).
Prepare and deliver presentations on project progress, learnings, and future recommendations for stakeholders and leadership.
This is a contract position
High Level:
At the takealot Group, our Graduate Programme will help you build both technical and soft-skills to launch your career, learning from the best in the business. The Graduate program will prepare you for a career in a large-scale and fast-paced environment.
Every selected Graduate gains unique insights into the e-commerce environment with vast amounts of practical experience from daily exposure to a broad range of skills. The program consists of various technical and soft skill courses where you will receive training on a variety of areas.
You'll be working with some of the strongest professionals South Africa has to offer who bring experience from a multitude of Great Industries.
The Environment:
takealot.com employees are entrepreneurial and dynamic, smart, customer-centric, fun and have the shared ambition of takealot.com being the leading e-commerce company in Africa.
We have fun, work hard, take ownership, work in teams to create solutions, and are always open to direct feedback/new ideas on where we can improve.
We are short on ego and high on output.
We are doers and not only thinkers, it's all in the execution after all.
We love what we do and what we are creating.
Let's talk about life @ Takealot Group
The power is in your hands: We offer a market-related, Total Remuneration Package which allows full flexibility according to your needs. Go on, be the master of your own destiny.
No doors: We aren't fans of stuffy offices or siloed work environments. See someone you like? High five, collab and make something great.
Mentorship Program: We aren't kidding when we say the people with the best people win. Now's your chance to be one of the best, by learning from the best.
Online Learning: Share ideas and grow with global industry leaders who are all just a Slack message away. Love to learn? Up-skill with free access to courses on MyAcademy, Udacity, Coursera and more.
Good times: Get to know the other extraordinary minds at takealot.com during regular social events and out-of-office activities (think hikes, think mini golf, think good times).
Help when you need it most: Confidential counselling, legal support and financial guidance, for free, anytime, anywhere.
Free parking: No more 5km fun runs to your desk (unless you want to).
Like what you see?
If you meet the above, you are an Extraordinary Mind. Apply today!!
Takealot is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants from previously disadvantaged groups and people with disabilities will be given preference.

Title: Remote Grant Writer
Description:
Parity Homes - Remote
Help Fuel the Mission to Rebuild Communities With Equity at the Center
Parity Homes is seeking a passionate and detail-driven Remote Grant Writer to join our mission-aligned team. In this role, you will research funding opportunities, craft compelling proposals, and secure resources that support our work transforming long-abandoned Baltimore rowhomes into pathways to wealth, stability, and community resilience.
Our small but ambitious team values collaboration, transparency, and craftsmanship--both in the homes we restore and the systems and partnerships we build. As part of a culture where every voice matters, your writing will play a central role in shaping the future of equitable housing investment.
Learn more about our mission in our TED Talk or visit us at www.parityhomes.com
Key Responsibilities
Research & Opportunity Identification
Conduct research to identify grant opportunities aligned with Parity Homes' mission and programs.
Stay informed on trends, best practices, and strategies in the grant-funding landscape.
Proposal Development
Collaborate with organizational leaders and program staff to understand funding needs and strategic priorities.
Draft, edit, and prepare grant proposals, letters of intent, and supporting documents.
Ensure all submissions meet funder guidelines, requirements, and deadlines.
Submission & Follow-up
Manage the full grant submission process to ensure accurate and timely delivery.
Maintain organized records of grant activities, submissions, and communications.
Follow up with funders to track proposal progress and requests.
Grant Management & Reporting
Assist with administration of awarded grants, ensuring compliance with terms and reporting requirements.
Collaborate with finance and program teams to prepare financial statements and impact updates.
Relationship Building
Cultivate and maintain relationships with funders, partners, and potential donors.
Represent Parity Homes in meetings and communications with funding agencies.
Additional Responsibilities
Support strategic planning to align grant-seeking efforts with organizational goals.
Provide training and guidance to staff on grant-writing best practices.
Perform other duties as needed to advance the mission.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in English, Communications, Nonprofit Management, or related field.
Proven experience as a grant writer with a successful track record.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Strong research, analytical, and critical-thinking abilities.
High attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Proficiency with grant databases, submission portals, and digital research tools.
Understanding of the nonprofit sector and funding ecosystem.
Preferred Attributes
Experience with grant administration and compliance reporting.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.
Strong organizational and time-management skills.
Working Conditions
Fully remote position with flexible hours.
Reliable internet connection and suitable home office required.
Performance Expectations
Research at least 5 grant opportunities per week.
Prepare and submit 10 high-quality grant proposals per month.
Complete timely and accurate reporting for all active grants.
Join Us
If you are a strategic thinker with a love for storytelling, strong attention to detail, and a passion for expanding equitable housing solutions, we encourage you to apply. Help us secure the resources needed to build stronger, more resilient communities--one proposal at a time.

Title: Payroll and Benefits Officer
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
Company Description
"Why work for Accor?
We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accorâ€™s limitless possibilities.
By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/
Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS"
Job Description
Scope of Position:
The primary role of the Payroll & Benefits Officer will be to manage all the payroll functions including processing monthly payroll, administers the benefits program, and compensation program. This is a very hands-on position, forming part of the People and Culture team and requires close interaction with the Finance Team on a regular basis.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Receives payroll information and will be responsible for accurate input of data into Company Payroll System.
Align and stream the payroll and benefits system.
Capture the monthly timesheet hours into the payroll system.
Capture Commissions and Gratuities into the payroll system.
Capture any adhoc payroll inputs and submissions, including deductions.
Capture all leave according to company policies and procedures.
Process Maternity leave remuneration in terms of the maternity leave contract.
Audit payroll balance sheets, YTD earnings, etc
Ensure the processing of new hires, temporary workers, transfers, promotions and terminations is accurate and timely
Completes appropriate changes to employees direct deposits, Tax changes and benefits
Manage regular preparation of relevant management reports, including weekly, monthly, quarterly and year-end reports (gross payroll, hours worked, leave accrual, tax deductions, benefit deductions, etc )
Submit South African Revenue Services returns and relevant documentation to the Department of Labour in connection with payroll and benefits.
Critically review and analyze current payroll, benefits and tax procedures in order to recommend and implement changes leading to best-practice operations.
Ensure systems are set-up and updated to reflect our current employee base, including wages, benefits, sick and leave time in line with contracts.
Balances Monthly Payroll and distributes reports and Employee Payslips.
Manages all the Employee Benefits, i.e., Medical Aid, Retirement Fund, Disability, Retirement Plans and Death Claims.
Assist with Salary Programs; ensuring equitable and consistent application of compensation policies and guidelines taking into consideration Salary and Remuneration Benchmarks.
Assist in the Administration of compensation programs, reviewing changes in salaries for conformance to policy; identify and analyze compensation problems and recommend solutions.
Assist with Off-Boarding of employees, including cancellation/transfer of Medical Aid, Provident Fund and ensure that the payroll system is updated accordingly.
Documents and maintains administrative procedures for compensation, benefits and payroll process.
Assists the other functions in the People and Culture department when required.
Competencies (Behavioural And Technical Skill Requirements)
Ability to function effectively in a rapidly changing organization.
Must be able to think logically and pay attention to details.
Ability to handle multiple competing priorities.
Provides outstanding customer service to answer questions/resolve issues related to benefits or payroll â€“ must have an approachable demeanor to all employees.
Strong working knowledge of payroll related legislation and tax laws.
Qualifications
Education and Experience:
Appropriate Payroll and/or HR Diploma.
Proficient in current payroll programmes such as Sage and Pay-Space.
5-7 years of related benefits and payroll management experience, knowledge of employee benefits laws and statutory requirements.
Proficient knowledge of PC software including Microsoft office, internet.
Ability to work independently and within a team environment
Ability to maintain strict adherence to confidentiality requirements.
Proficiencies in South African Employee benefits products including Retirement Benefits and Medical Health Benefits.
Additional Information
EMPLOYMENT EQUITY
We as a company are committed to diversity and inclusion. Our Employment Equity Plan and Targets will be considered during the recruitment process. We welcome applications from individuals with disabilities and diverse backgrounds.

Title: Digital Marketing Project Manager
Description:
The Digital Marketing Project Manager is responsible for overseeing the operational engine of the Paid Media department. This role ensures all paid media projects are executed on time, strategists are fully supported with organized assets and information, client communication is timely and professional, and performance data remains accurate and consistently updated.
As the Project Manager, you manage project workflows, guide other project managers, uphold standards, and act as the communication hub between Paid Media and surrounding departments. You maintain high-level visibility across all accounts, eliminate bottlenecks, drive operational excellence, and ensure that every project is delivered with precision and consistency.
This role is built for a highly organized, proactive, and detail-driven leader who thrives in a fast-paced digital agency and understands the full marketing ecosystem.
Growth99 (https://growth99.com/) provides advanced software and digital marketing solutions tailored for aesthetic and elective wellness practices, focusing on enhancing online presence, patient engagement, and operational efficiency. Our comprehensive services include website development, SEO, social media, paid media management, and AI-driven tools to help practices grow and thrive in a competitive market.
Working Hours: 3:30 pm - 12:00 am SAST (M-F)
Duties/Responsibilities:
Project Management & Workflow Leadership
Oversee the end-to-end lifecycle for all paid media projects, from onboarding and setup to launch and ongoing optimization cycles.
Develop and maintain advanced project plans, department-wide trackers, and campaign timelines.
Assign tasks, manage workloads, and support junior project managers in prioritizing deliverables.
Ensure deadlines are consistently met and internal SLAs are followed across the paid media team.
Identify risks early and implement solutions before they impact performance or timelines.
Strategist Enablement & Operational Preparedness
Organize, audit, and prepare all required assets for strategists to execute and optimize campaigns.
Maintain clean documentation across onboarding forms, creative assets, tracking sheets, and reporting dashboards.
Perform pre-launch QA to verify all tracking, access, CRM triggers, and campaign requirements are complete before handoff.
Build systems and standards that increase strategist efficiency and reduce repetitive tasks.
Cross-Department Communication
As the Project Manager, you oversee and direct all cross-department communication for paid media operations. You ensure information flows accurately and consistently between internal teams throughout the client journey. This includes proactively aligning teams on priorities, clarifying expectations, resolving communication gaps, and ensuring each department has the context and resources needed to execute their work effectively.
You set the communication standard for the project management team, maintain operational cohesion across the organization, and guide project managers in best practices for internal coordination.
Client Communication & Email Oversight
Ensure all client emails are responded to quickly, accurately, and professionally.
Route communication to the correct strategist or operational owner and maintain communication logs.
Draft organized updates, onboarding instructions, and next-step summaries on behalf of the Paid Media department.
Support CX alignment by ensuring clients receive consistent messaging across all stages.
Data Management & Reporting Integrity
Maintain accurate and up-to-date reporting sheets for budgets, ad spend pacing, campaign performance, and lead flow.
Audit data regularly and correct errors, inconsistencies, or broken formulas.
Uphold naming conventions, tracking standards, and internal documentation protocols.
Guide PMs in maintaining high-level data hygiene and enforcing reporting discipline.
Operational Quality Control
Validate every aspect of the campaign setup before launch: tracking, pixels, events, UTMs, domains, access levels, CRM triggers, and creative quality.
Develop QA checklists, review processes, and spot-check systems to ensure launch accuracy.
Escalate technical or operational issues to appropriate departments quickly and clearly.
Process Optimization & SOP Development
Build and refine SOPs, workflows, checklists, and training documents for the project management team.
Identify operational bottlenecks and implement improvements to increase efficiency and reduce errors.
Champion best practices across Paid Media and enforce process consistency across all PMs.
Lead internal process reviews and support cross-functional operational improvements.
Record all Updates on Zoho/ Hubspot for cross-department communication
Required Skills & Competencies:
Technical Expertise
Advanced Google Sheets: QUERY, ARRAYFORMULA, REGEXEXTRACT, XLOOKUP, INDEX-MATCH, IMPORTRANGE, Pivot Tables.
Strong understanding of paid media ecosystems (Google Ads, Meta Ads, TikTok Ads, YouTube).
CRM systems (Go High Level, HubSpot, Zoho).
Basic Intermediate analytics experience for QA: GA4, Tag Manager, event tracking, UTM structures, pixel QA.
Familiarity with funnel strategy, automation logic, and performance metrics.
Leadership & Project Management
Experience managing both projects and people within a digital marketing or agency environment.
Strong capacity planning, team delegation, and workflow optimization skills.
Ability to run production meetings, roadmap planning sessions, and internal alignment calls.
High-level organizational skills with impeccable attention to detail.
Communication & Collaboration
Clear, concise communicator who excels at managing expectations across departments.
Strong documentation habits and ability to teach best practices to junior PMs.
Skilled at translating strategy into operational steps and resolving communication breakdowns.
High emotional intelligence, professionalism, and situational awareness.
Analytical & Operational Strengths
Ability to analyze campaign data and identify gaps, risks, or opportunities.
Strong systems thinking: understanding how each part of the workflow impacts overall campaign performance.
Methodical, proactive problem solver who thrives in structured processes and process creation.
Education & Experience
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or related field preferred.
5+Â  years of project management or operations experience in a digital marketing or agency setting.
2+ years Leadership or team lead experience.
Relevant project management, digital marketing, or analytics certifications are a plus.
Success Metrics
On-time delivery rate across all paid media projects.
Improved strategist efficiency and reduced operational back-and-forth.
High data accuracy across all reporting and performance tracking.
Strong internal alignment and communication flow across teams.
Demonstrable improvements in PM team performance, processes, and workflows.
Reduction in launch errors and operational inconsistencies.

Title: Civil QC
Description:
RINA is currently looking for
CIVIL QC
in South Africa (Eastern Cape).
Essential functions\duties:
Ensuring, with support of HS and Environment Manager, the implementation of safety and hygiene provisions in the workplace and environmental protection, in compliance with local legislation.
Assuring the compliance of civil works performed with Issued for Construction (IFC) Design, Technical Specification, contractual requirements, quality, local laws and site sustainability.
Monitoring and tracking the progress of civil work activities, promptly detecting eventual criticalities or delays and proceeding in problem solving by coordinating with Site Manager\Coordinator, in order to reach schedule objectives defined.
Performing the measurement and classification of work executed and the compilation of the booklets of measurements and accounting (services entry sheet) required for the payment release.
Implementing Quality Control Plan on site, attending to the test execution when needed, and checking test reports and field data to assure quality requirement are being met.
Detecting possible nonconformities during the works activities, promptly informing the Site Manager\Coordinator and supporting him/her in Non Conformity Report opening and problem solving.
Supporting the Site Coordinator by ensuring the implementation of Design Change and Non Conformity resolution during construction and assembly activities.
Ensuring the compliance of the material delivered on site with the Technical specification and Design requirements.
Supervise civil C&SCs in order to meet technical and quality requirements set forth in civil drawings and specifications.
Responsible for monitoring and tracking all civil activities relating to project schedule.
Assist the on-site construction team in resolving technical or engineering issues with vendors and C&SCs relating to civil disciplines.
Attend all progress meetings.
AutoCAD design/drafting as necessary to assist the design team.
Check, verify and sign off quality of the works
Enforce health, safety and environmental plan and report non compliances
Tools in charge to the Site Civil Supervisor
Daily Inspection Report
Site Test forms
IFC Drawings, Design TSs, Quality Control Procedures
Smart glass inspection â€“ remote inspections
Main Accountability
Data of Daily work progress and monitoring of their execution
Data of Daily manpower and crews
Validation of Site tests (with or without attendance) and Delivery certificates
Validation of Qualification reports of the Material purchased by the C&SCs with support of OWNER engineering disciplines
Validation of expediting\delivery certificates of the material
Participation in the teams to check\close the punch lists and their validations
Requirements:
The Civil Supervisor will be required to have a minimum of 5 years of professional cumulative experience in this role or equivalent.
BS Degree in Civil Engineering or equivalent discipline technical diploma.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, MS Project).
Knowledge of AutoCAD.
Valid Driverâ€™s License.
Ability to work in both indoor and outdoor environments in adverse and extreme weather conditions and in confined spaces, heights and in energized Power Plants.
Knowledge of steel works execution, including micro piles and relevant supply requirements with the relevant applicable local codes in force.
Must be experienced in the concrete\grout production, supply and pouring procedure with the relevant quality controls and qualification with the relevant applicable local codes in force.
Knowledge of monitoring and testing of road and earth work execution with the relevant applicable local codes in force in their latest and most updated version.
Knowledge of reinforced steel concrete execution, including pre-stressed with the relevant applicable local codes in force in their latest and most updated version.
Knowledge of local codes and standard about main technical aspects of civil constructions, constructions safety in their latest and most updated version.
Knowledge of control and acceptance procedure related of at least all civil items listed in Chapter 6.
Possibility to work during day/ night shift (including weekends).
Extensive travel with temporary relocation to construction sites for 6-24 months durations
SACPCMP registration
Industries: Mechanical Or Industrial Engineering, Environmental Services, and Information Technology & Services

Title: Case Manager Coordinator
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
Position: Case Management Coordinator
Primary Purpose of the Role
The successful candidate will be responsible for coordinating the hospital case management process and facilitating effective communication between all relevant stakeholders. This role aims to ensure the provision of accurate, timely clinical information to minimise financial risk to the organisation.
Key Responsibility Areas
Effectively manage patient stays to minimise financial risk to the organisation.
Ensure compliance with case management procedures, contractual agreements, and relevant legal requirements through the appropriate use of available systems and resources.
Ensure the accurate and timeous finalisation of cases to facilitate reimbursement of claims from medical funders.
Maintain consistent and timely communication with funders, in accordance with contractual agreements and through approved case management channels.
Ensure adherence to clinical coding standards in line with Level 3 coding guidelines.
Skills and Competencies
Computer literacy, with proficiency in Microsoft Office.
Proven experience in authorisation and motivation processes relating to level of care, length of stay, short payments, and related case management matters.
Sound knowledge of patient administration policies and procedures, including patient confidentiality and the management of external case manager visits.
Strong understanding of daily hospital workflows, deviation management, clinical coding, and case management processes.
Excellent communication, organisational, and administrative skills.

Title: Warehouse Controller
Description:
Permanent
PBCS Hams.Dale
Overview
We are a Supply Chain and Sales & Merchandising partner adding value to your business through a fully integrated, temperature-controlled network in Southern Africa.
But we are also more than that. We are people serving people. While we boast the best in tech and infrastructure, our people are our greatest resource. With our skilled, curious, can-do people at the forefront, our assets become your assets, our service your solutions.
Vectorâ€™s vehicle fleet includes a food industry first in â€˜multi-temperatureâ€™ vehicles enabling the company to service business across frozen, chilled and ambient temperature zones on a single delivery.
Job Purpose
To oversee the safe receipt, storage, retrieval and timely dispatch of goods for PSD / CSD, thereby meeting customer service levels and reducing costs.
Key Responsibilities
Strategy Execution
Work closely with the Warehouse Manager and/or Logistics Manager and the transport management team to ensure the delivery of an integrated supply chain benefit and strategic target achievement.
Drive the implementation of improvements in PSD / CSD warehouse operations to achieve significant gains in efficiency.
Ensure the implementation of warehouse best operating practices and standardised procedures / practices throughout the warehouse.
Manage the system for keeping PSD / CSD stock control systems up to date and plan future capacity requirements based on forward planning.
Operations Management
Control and monitor PSD / CSD inventory levels and replenishment processes.
Maintain the physical condition of the warehouse(s) by planning and implementing new design layouts in conjunction with the Warehouse Manager / Logistics Manager; inspecting facilities and equipment; issuing work orders for repair and requisitions for replacement.
Manage PSD / CSD operational requirements by deploying warehouse operational and administrative employees and following up on work results.
Continuously consider cost reducing strategies over all activities of the warehouse.
Manage the housekeeping of the warehouse(s) and surrounding area.
Plan the arrangement of goods within the warehouse and ensure special requirements for certain stock, such as chilled goods or fragile products are met.
Manage the system of picking, checking and loading to ensure productivity and compliance targets are met.
Ensures that all tasks, activities and operations that are carried out on the day shift are coordinated with night duties and activities.
Effectively and in a timely manner communicate with the Logistics Manager and Warehouse Manager regarding any issues, exceptions or problems occurring on the nightshift that warrant their attention.
Ensure customer orders are filled and placed on trucks in the proper order as described in the loading procedures.
Ensure that all orders leaving the warehouse are correctly packed and damage free.
Manage the execution of the transport plan for PSD / CSD.
Oversee returns and the document process back into SAP.
Perform regular system health checks regarding replenishments, transfers, returns not completed.
Warehouse Administration Management
Oversee the warehouse administration, ensuring that all goods receipting and issuing documents are accurately and promptly processed.
Monitor the warehouse billing status.
Ensure computerised administration and automated storage and retrieval systems are accurately maintained.
Analyse and provide the inventory report, IN/OUT status report, dead stock report, goods age report, consumption report, manpower status report to the Logistics Manager.
Audit daily labour and billing reports.
Warehouse Maintenance Management
Oversee the planned and unplanned maintenance of warehouse equipment.
Customers Service Level Management
Resolve issues encountered around damaged or short stock.
Risk Management
Ensure ISO compliance throughout the warehouse(s), including health and safety and food safety.
Conduct daily health inspections and risk compliance inspections incorporating forklift inspections, lighting inspections, reachtruck inspections, facility inspections, and damaged stock.
Participate in the risk committee and in HIRA workstudies.
Ensure warehouse compliance with all national and provincial legislation and regulations, international SHERQ standards and with company policy.
Ensure the safeguarding of warehouse operations and contents by establishing and monitoring security procedures and protocols.
Team Management
Monitor team performance and provide regular performance feedback.
Coach and support the team where necessary to achieve objectives.
Lead the team towards meeting the strategy and targets through regular communication and utilisation of the full organisational talent management tool set.
Address poor performance in individuals and teams in accordance with company policy and the relevant legislation.
Conduct regular meetings and ensure that records are kept and shared across the team and that action plans agreed to within team meetings are delivered upon.
Key Relationships
Internal
Transport team.
Broader planning team.
SHEQ and risk management.
Finance administration team.
External
Customers.
Transport contractors.
Qualifications And Experience
Qualifications, Skills and Experience Required for the Job
National Diploma in Warehouse/Logistics Management.
Valid Code EB driversâ€™ license.
4 - 6 yearsâ€™ experience in a warehouse environment, 3 of which in a Supervisory / Team Leader position.
Skills and Competencies
System skills (SAP MM and BW, MS Office skills prerequisite).
Verbal and written communication.
Computer literacy.
Interpersonal.
Logical thinking.
Analytical thinking.
Numeracy.
Organizational awareness.
Vector Logistics supports the principles of Employment Equity and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Preference will be given to candidates from designated groups in line with our Employment Equity Plan.
If you have not heard from us within 3 to 4 weeks after submitting your application, please consider your application unsuccessful on this occasion. We truly appreciate your interest in joining the Vector team and encourage you to stay connected for future opportunities that may align with your skills and career journey.
We look forward to hearing from you!
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

Title: Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
Description:
Role Description:
The Chief Technology Officer (CTO) is a key member of the executive leadership team, responsible for developing and executing the companyâ€™s technological vision and strategy. This role drives innovation, oversees all aspects of the companyâ€™s technology development, and ensures that technological resources are aligned with the companyâ€™s business goals. The CTO will lead the engineering and IT teams, manage technological budgets, and foster a culture of continuous improvement, security, and scalability.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and execute the companyâ€™s technology strategy to support long-term goals.
Lead the design, development, and implementation of scalable and secure technology platforms.
Oversee all system design and changes in system architecture.
Evaluate and implement new technologies that yield competitive advantage.
Establish and enforce software development and operational standards.
Collaborate with other executives to align technology initiatives with business objectives.
Manage technical teams, including software engineers, IT, DevOps, and product development staff.
Drive innovation through research, experimentation, and strategic tech partnerships.
Monitor KPIs and IT budgets to assess technological performance and ROI.

Represent the company in technical discussions with stakeholders, partners, and investors.
Qualifications:
Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.

Strong background in software development, systems architecture, and emerging technologies.

Excellent leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
Strategic thinking with a hands-on approach to solving complex problems.
Experience working in startup, high-growth, or innovation-driven environments is a plus.
Preferred Skills and Traits:

Title: Certified Occupational Therapy Assistant
Description:
Location
Related Services
Reference #
2026-221A
Close Date
open until filled
Location
Related Services
Reference #
2026-221A
Close Date
open until filled
Summary
Under the direction of the Occupational Therapist, the Certified Occupational Therapy Assistant assesses student functioning, makes occupational therapy-related treatment recommendations, and assists teachers and parents with treatment interventions
Description
Classified job announcement for all qualified applicants. Certified Occupational Therapy Assistant // Related Services 7 hours a day // 174 days a year // Salary Grade 13 - $27.62 per hour (Support Salary Table 2025-2026) To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential job functions satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the primary job functions herein described. Since every duty associated with this position may not be described herein, employees may be required to perform duties not specifically spelled out in the job description, but which may be reasonably considered to be incidental in the performing of their duties just as though they were actually written out in this job description. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS * Assists with assessment of student functioning (e.g., self-regulation, fine motor skills, developmental level). This may involve practices such as observation of students in classroom and other settings, gathering of work samples, conducting interviews, reviewing files and the administration and scoring of standardized tests. * Assists with preparation of 504 plans and IEP long-term goals and goal-related benchmarks. * Participates in IEP and 504 meetings. Discusses, coordinates and answers questions regarding plan elements with IEP team. Explains the occupational therapy evaluations to parents. Assists with implementation of plans. * Performs "activity analysis" of student required tasks. * Consults with classroom teachers, resource teachers, etc. to review student evaluations and to propose strategies and make recommendations. * Assists Occupational Therapist with development, maintenance and modification of treatment plans. Provides teachers, students and parents with lists of performance enhancement activities and strategies for students. Answers questions relating to occupational therapy. * Records and maintains daily skill and goal accomplishment progress notes, consolidating at the end of each term. Updates and makes adjustments to goals as necessary. Documents analyses and evaluations. * Mentors and assists occupational therapy assistant college students. * Directs activities of fine motor assistants. * Fabricates or recommends the purchase of adaptive equipment. * Drives personal automobile to various school locations within the district. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS * Associate's degree in occupational therapy plus two 8-week internships in specialty area. * Some experience related to skills above preferred. * Certification as Occupational Therapy Assistant. * Driver's license. * Occupational Therapy Assistant license in the state of Utah. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES * Ability to train and/or work with adults and children; strong interpersonal skills. * Ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing. * Knowledge of early childhood development stages/processes. * Ability to administer and score standardized tests. * Basic office skills (e.g., filing, word processing). * Ability to operate computer. * Ability to research and develop individualized student interventions. * Ability to manage inventory and property. PHYSICAL DEMANDS Medium work: Exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 30 pounds of force frequently, and/or up to 10 pounds of force constantly to move objects. The work also requires the following physical abilities in order to perform the essential job functions: balancing, crawling, fingering, grasping, handling, hearing, kneeling, lifting, mental acuity, pulling, pushing, reaching, repetitive motion, speaking, talking, visual acuity and walking. WORKING CONDITIONS Employees in this position work in a dynamic environment that requires them to be sensitive to change and responsive to changing goals, priorities, and needs.

Title: QA Tester
Description:
Our client develops and maintains a suite of web applications and digital products that support cross-functional teams and evolving technology initiatives. They focus on delivering high-quality user experiences through strong product development practices, continuous iteration, and reliable software quality. Their environment is collaborative, fast-moving, and rooted in improving how users interact with complex systems.
Location
Fully Remote | 9 AM - 5 PM EST
Role Overview
The QA Tester will support quality assurance efforts across multiple web applications and digital products. This role requires strong organization, familiarity with testing tools, and the ability to test complex systems without coding.
The QA Tester will collaborate closely with product, engineering, and design teams to ensure accuracy, reliability, and adherence to requirements across software releases.
Key Responsibilities
Functional, Regression, and Exploratory Testing
Execute functional, regression, integration, and exploratory testing across multiple web applications and products.
Create, maintain, and execute test cases, test plans, and test suites to ensure full coverage.
Bug Tracking and Defect Management
Identify, document, and track defects using bug-tracking tools such as Jira.
Validate fixes and perform re-testing to ensure defect resolution and prevent regressions.
Collaboration and Communication
Collaborate with product managers, developers, and designers to clarify requirements and ensure product quality.
Provide clear reporting on test progress, coverage, and results to relevant stakeholders.
Automation Support (No Coding Required)
Assist with automation efforts by maintaining and executing automated test scripts.
Apply technical understanding of automation tools such as Selenium, Playwright, or Cypress (coding not required).
Process Improvement
Identify opportunities to improve QA processes and enhance overall product quality.
Qualifications
Experience
2+ years of experience on a QA or software testing team.
Hands-on experience testing web applications, focusing on UI/UX validation.
Experience writing and executing test cases and test scripts.
Experience with bug-tracking tools such as Jira or similar.
Familiarity with automated testing concepts and tools such as Selenium, Playwright, or Cypress.
Experience testing APIs using tools like Postman or Insomnia (preferred).
Exposure to version control systems such as git/GitHub.
Knowledge of accessibility testing standards such as WCAG.
Experience with performance or load testing tools.
Familiarity with test management platforms.
Skills
Strong understanding of QA methodologies, testing techniques, and the full software development lifecycle.
Ability to break down problems, identify edge cases, and think critically about user behavior.
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Strong organization, documentation, and time-management abilities.
Highly detail-oriented with strong ownership and accountability.
Curious, proactive, and committed to identifying defects before users do.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, iterative, and collaborative environment.
Motivated to contribute to the continuous improvement of quality practices and team processes.
API testing experience, especially Postman is a plus.
What Success Looks Like
Well-executed test cases and defect-free releases.
Clear communication of testing progress with high-quality bug documentation.
A smooth testing process with minimal disruptions to the development pipeline.
Ongoing contributions that improve product quality and QA effectiveness.
Opportunity
This role offers the opportunity to work on high-quality web applications while contributing to continuous improvement efforts across the QA function. The QA Tester will collaborate with a cross-functional team, enhance their skill set with modern tools, and play a key role in ensuring reliable, user-centered software. Candidates who are passionate about quality assurance, problem-solving, and agile development will thrive in this environment. Apply now!
Application Process
To be considered for this role these steps need to be followed:
Fill in the application form
Record a video showcasing your skill sets

Title: Senior Delivery Consultant
Description:
Who You'll Work With
Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.
In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleaguesâ€”at all levelsâ€”will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you wonâ€™t find anywhere else.
When you join us, you will have:
Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. Youâ€™ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions, all while upholding our unwavering commitment to ethics and integrity. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firmâ€™s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, youâ€™ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.
Your Impact
As the Senior Delivery Consultant, you will manage workstreams largely independently, with the support of a project manager. As you gain experience, you will gradually assume responsibility for delivering parts of projects yourself.
A key part of your role will be to implement business transformation and digital transformation programmes mainly into the mining, banking or telco sectors, ensuring long term impact delivery. You will lead junior consultants and clients in your project or workstream and successfully hold client meetings and workshops to achieve the project's objectives. In addition, you will grow in a stimulating and human environment where quality of life at work is important.
You will be based in our Johannesburg office as part of Orphoz, working closely and in partnership with client's senior management and their specialist departments.
As a subsidiary of McKinsey & Company, Orphoz offers a unique combination of experience, knowledge, network resources, and flexibility. Within our collaborative community, we deliver business transformation including restructuring, turnaround, post-merger implementation, and more. We realize strategy and execute it with our clients. Orphoz integrates the skills, approach, corporate culture, and resources that lead to the success of complex transformation projects and is ideally positioned to smoothly implement strategies designed by McKinsey & Company.
Orphoz helps our leading private sector clients achieve one of their biggest challenges: making their business transformation plans really happen. Our day-to-day work is to support large companies who need to adapt their operating models to the accelerated changes in their environment by combining agility, sustainable efficiency, and employee engagement. Overall, we exist to deliver a lasting impact to our clients.
With Orphoz, you can expect a uniquely varied and exciting working environment, as well as the opportunity to work with a talented and dynamic growing team. We plan and deliver change projects together with our clients, helping them capture their full potential. We know what determines the success of large projects and what can ensure lasting implementation success. We combine strategic and operational project management with strong execution skills and an understanding of the specific demands of each industry. We measure our success by achieving the goals we set together with our clients.
Your Qualifications and Skills
3+ years of experience in project management delivery coming from a consulting or large corporate environment with high problem solving ability
2+ yearsâ€™ experience delivering and execution large scale business transformation projects including: restructuring execution, turnaround, execution, operational excellence, strategic operations, operational strategy, operational consulting transformation and M&A PMI (post-merger implementation) business transformation or digital transformation projects.
You are driven by creating long lasting impact and enjoy working with people to achieve results
Experience working in Mining, Banking (financial services) or Telco (Telecommunications) is highly desirable
You have strong pragmatic problem-solving skills
You enjoy the flexibility and agility that is required in a consulting environment

Title: Senior Sales Development Representative
Description:
Stop Earning Rands. Start Earning Dollars.
THE OPPORTUNITY
We are
Mainspring
, a US-based financial technology firm. We provide Payment Processing, Payroll, and Time & Attendance solutions to American small businesses.
We are building an elite
"Special Forces" Sales Team
in South Africa. We are not looking for call center agents who read scripts like robots. We are looking for
Hunters
.
Most sales jobs in South Africa cap your growth, pay you in a depreciating currency, and treat you like a number. We are different.
We pay a
premium US salary
to secure the top 1% of talent in the country.
THE MISSION
Your objective is
Displacement
. You will call business owners in the United States (restaurants, retailers, auto shops) who already have a provider. You must cut through the noise, build instant credibility, and book a meeting for our Senior Closers.
The Grind:
You will dial 80â€“100 numbers a day.
The Reality:
You will get hung up on. You will face rejection.
The Test:
Can you hear "No" 99 times, keep your energy high, and book the meeting on the 100th call?
WHO YOU ARE
We don't care about your degree. We care about your
Intelligence
and your
Grit
.
Fluid Intelligence:
You can calculate a merchant's savings on the fly. You can understand complex financial concepts (Interchange-Plus pricing, Tax burdens) and can pivot a conversation instantly when a prospect throws a curveball.
Unshakeable Grit:
You view sales as a sport. You don't take rejection personally; you take it professionally.
"Load Shedding Proof":
You are a professional remote worker. You have your own
UPS/Inverter
and
Fiber Line
. You do not make excuses about power; you make calls.
Voice Command:
You speak native-level English with a clear, neutral accent. You sound like a high-level consultant, not a telemarketer.
THE OFFER
Elite Base Salary:
$2,000 USD / Month
(Fixed).
Context:
At current exchange rates, this places you in the top tier of earners for individual contributor roles in SA.
Aggressive Commission:
Earn
$50â€“$75 USD
for every qualified appointment that shows.
Earn a
$300 USD
bonus for every deal that closes.
Realistic On-Target Earnings (OTE): $3,500-$6,000 USD / Month.
Lifestyle Friendly Hours:
3:00 PM â€“ 11:00 PM SAST
(8:00 AM â€“ 4:00 PM EST).
Why this matters:
You skip the morning rush hour traffic and have your days free for the gym, family, or personal growth, while avoiding the brutal "graveyard shift" of many call centers.
Stability:
This is a long-term role. We are looking for career partners, not gig workers.
REQUIREMENTS
Minimum 1 year of high-velocity outbound cold calling experience (US, UK, or Australian markets preferred).
A quiet home office environment (no background noise).
Preferred:
Tech savvy (experience with CRMs like Salesforce/HubSpot and VoIP dialers).

Title: IT Software Developer
Location: East London, Eastern Cape, South Africa
Description:
About The Role
Our client, a leading organisation specialising in the development, leasing, and management of commercial and industrial real estate, is seeking a skilled
IT Software Developer
to join their dynamic team.
This is an excellent opportunity to contribute to a forward-thinking company where
ethics, innovation, customer service, and teamwork
are at the core of success.
Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with users and stakeholders to gather, analyse, and document system requirements, translating them into functional specifications.
Conduct system upgrades, patch management, and configuration changes while minimising operational disruption.
Assist in the implementation and rollout of new applications and systems, including testing, training, and ongoing support.
Support data integrity, migration, and system integration using APIs, ETL tools, or scripting.
Ensure applications meet compliance, security, and performance standards.
Provide Tier 2/3 technical support for escalated application and enterprise system issues.
Develop and maintain backend services, APIs, and integrations.
Build responsive, maintainable frontend components when required.
Write clean, testable, and well-documented code following coding best practices.
Participate in code reviews, testing, and deployment processes.
Troubleshoot and resolve software defects and performance issues.
Contribute to CI/CD pipeline development and DevOps initiatives.
Enhance system security, scalability, and performance.
Provide day-to-day systems support and resolve technical issues promptly.
Review existing systems, interfaces, and procedures to identify automation and optimisation opportunities.
Collaborate with management to design and develop internal and external management reports to support business decisions.
Liaise with external stakeholders and third-party developers where required.
Requirements
Requirements
Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Software Development.
3â€“5 years of software development experience.
Broad knowledge and experience with accounting systems and ERP platforms.
Proven experience in both project-based and business-as-usual (BAU) environments.
Experience within the property industry is advantageous.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and general computer software.
Technical & Core Skills
Up-to-date knowledge of current IT application trends and best practices.
Strong analytical and numerical abilities with attention to detail.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build and maintain stakeholder relationships.
Experience in scripting or programming.
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Proficiency in at least one backend language:
C#/.NET, Java, Node.js (JavaScript/TypeScript), C++, or Python.

Title: Account Manager
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
Department:
Customer Service and Client Relations
Work Arrangement:
Remote
Job Type:
Independent Contractor, Full Time
Work Schedule:
US Time Zone (candidate expected to be flexible with the client's preference)
Locations:
Philippines, LATAM, South Africa, Kenya, and other remote regions with excellent English communication skills
About Pearl Talent
Pearl works with the top 1% of candidates from around the world and connects them with the best startups in the US and EU. Our clients have raised over $5B in aggregate and are backed by companies like OpenAI, a16z, and Founders Fund. They're looking for the sharpest, hungriest candidates who they can consistently promote and work with over many years. Candidates we've hired have been flown out to the US and EU to work with their clients, and even promoted to roles that match folks onshore in the US.
Hear why we exist, what we believe in, and who we're building for:
WATCH HERE
Why Work with Us?
At Pearl, we're not just another recruiting firmâ€”we connect you with exceptional opportunities to work alongside visionary US and EU founders. Our focus is on placing you in roles where you can grow, be challenged, and build long-term, meaningful careers.
Role Overview
The Account Manager serves as the key custodian of the client experience, owning post-sale relationships and ensuring long-term client satisfaction, retention, and growth. This role goes beyond traditional account managementâ€”you'll build white-glove relationships with vendors, contractors, healthcare providers, and B2B clients across diverse industries including SaaS, construction tech, healthcare AI, and social commerce platforms. You'll act as the internal voice of your clients, capturing feedback, anticipating needs, driving product adoption, and identifying opportunities for expansion and referrals while maintaining the highest standards of service excellence.
Your Impact
Your work will directly influence client retention, satisfaction, and revenue growth by ensuring every account receives exceptional, personalized support. You'll transform trial users into long-term subscribers and turn satisfied clients into brand advocates who provide referrals. By deeply understanding client needs and surfacing feedback to product teams, you'll shape product direction and improve offerings. Your ability to build trust, maintain detailed client insights, and provide strategic guidance will strengthen partnerships that drive sustainable business growth. In fast-growing startups, you'll be instrumental in scaling the client experience while maintaining the personal touch that sets companies apart.
Core Responsibilities
Account Relationship Management & Client Success (35%)
Own and manage post-sale relationships with 20-30 client accounts concurrently
Serve as primary point of contact for assigned clients, ensuring high satisfaction and retention
Build detailed understanding of each client's business goals, needs, tone, and preferences
Develop and maintain strong, trust-based relationships with vendors, contractors, and healthcare providers
Act as strategic partner understanding clients' objectives and proactively offering solutions
Conduct regular check-ins, business reviews, and relationship-building touchpoints
Ensure clients receive immediate value and see ROI from products or services
Build rapport through polished, warm, and professionally presentable client interactions
Client Onboarding & Product Adoption (25%)
Conduct structured onboarding and re-onboarding processes that feel personalized and elite
Build detailed onboarding plans, playbooks, and SOPs for consistent client experiences
Guide users through product activation and ensure seamless adoption
Provide education and training on platform capabilities, features, and best practices
Onboard new clients with clear guidance on how to leverage solutions for maximum impact
Monitor early adoption patterns and provide proactive support during critical phases
Ensure clients fully understand and utilize product capabilities to achieve their goals
Growth, Expansion & Revenue Optimization (20%)
Monitor and analyze client usage data to identify opportunities for improvement and upselling
Identify expansion opportunities including upsells, cross-sells, and account growth
Develop and execute strategies to enhance user adoption and retention
Subtly request referrals and testimonials from satisfied clients
Assist with referral generation programs and upsell motions as appropriate
Run outreach campaigns including prospect targeting and follow-up tracking
Convert trial users into long-term subscribers through strategic engagement
Track conversion metrics and adjust strategies to improve success rates
Client Advocacy & Cross-Functional Collaboration (15%)
Act as internal voice of the client, surfacing feedback and performance blockers to relevant teams
Work cross-functionally with sales, product, engineering, and operations to address client needs
Collaborate with connector/partner success teams to align clients with ideal profiles
Provide ongoing support, troubleshoot issues, and escalate concerns appropriately
Advocate for clients internally ensuring their needs influence product and process decisions
Support events and community initiatives (founder dinners, networking, strategy planning)
Stay up to date with industry trends to innovate and improve client engagement approaches
Documentation, Reporting & Performance Tracking (5%)
Track all account data, performance metrics, and interaction notes in CRM systems (HubSpot, Salesforce)
Maintain detailed vendor/client insights including preferences, history, and context
Capture and document client feedback through NPS surveys and structured feedback loops
Generate reports on account health, engagement metrics, and key performance indicators
Maintain accurate CRM data with extreme attention to detail in call notes and context tracking
Document best practices, successful strategies, and lessons learned for team knowledge sharing
Requirements
Must-Haves (Required)
Experience: 1-2+ years in account management, customer success, client-facing roles, or B2B sales (preferably in SaaS, healthcare, construction tech, or relationship-driven businesses)
Communication: Flawless written and verbal English communication skills with polished, professional delivery
CRM Proficiency: Familiarity with HubSpot, Salesforce, or similar CRM platforms
Relationship Management: Strong ability to build and maintain relationships across diverse client types
Multitasking: Capable of managing 20-30 client relationships concurrently with consistent quality
Organization: Extreme attention to detail, particularly with CRM data, call notes, and context tracking
Client Presentation: Polished, warm, and professionally presentable for high-touch client interactions
Self-Management: Highly organized, self-managing, and proactive in client engagement
Emotional Intelligence: Strong interpersonal skills with empathy and cultural awareness
Adaptability: Open to feedback and thrives in fast-paced, dynamic environments
Problem-Solving: Excellent analytical and conflict-resolution abilities
Remote Work: Proven ability to work independently in remote, asynchronous environments
Nice-to-Haves (Preferred)
Background in B2B customer success, partnerships, or strategic account management
Experience supporting startups, SaaS platforms, or high-growth technology businesses
Exposure to startup community, founder ecosystem, or high-end networking circles
Experience in healthcare, construction, social commerce, or AI-driven solutions
Familiarity with clinical workflows, provider pain points, or construction industry dynamics
Understanding of technical products and ability to explain complex concepts simply
Experience with referral generation programs and community-building initiatives
Background in sales strategy development and execution
Coachability and hunger to learn and grow in fast-scaling companies
Passion for human-centric products, user experience, and relationship-driven services
Tools ProficiencyMust-Haves (Required)
CRM Systems: HubSpot, Salesforce, or equivalent customer relationship management platforms
Communication: Email (Gmail/Outlook), Slack, Microsoft Teams, Zoom
Documentation: Notion, Google Docs, Google Workspace
Scheduling: Calendly, Google Calendar, or equivalent booking systems
Video Conferencing: Zoom, Google Meet, or Microsoft Teams
Nice-to-Haves (Preferred)
VoIP/Dialers: OpenPhone or similar communication tools
Payment Processing: Stripe or similar billing platforms
Project Management: Asana, Trello, ClickUp, or Airtable
Analytics: Data visualization tools or dashboards for tracking account metrics
Marketing Automation: HubSpot Marketing, Mailchimp, or similar platforms
Collaboration: Miro, Figma, or other collaborative tools
Industry-Specific Tools: Construction software, healthcare platforms, or specialized SaaS tools
Benefits
Competitive Salary: Based on experience and skills
Remote Work: Fully remote â€” work from anywhere
Generous PTO: In accordance with company policy
Direct Mentorship: Access to global industry leaders
Learning & Development: Continuous growth resources
Global Networking: Work with international teams
Health Coverage (Philippines only): HMO after 3 months (full-time)

If you're proactive, reliable, and excited to work with high-performing teams across industries, we'd love to hear from you. Apply today and become part of Pearl Talent's global community.
